[("Baltimore Orioles: Eat the rest of Ubaldo Jimenez's contract?", "The Baltimore Orioles might have arrived at a crossroads with Ubaldo Jimenez. Should they eat what\xe2\x80\x99s left of his contract?The Baltimore Orioles have a decision to make on\xc2\xa0Ubaldo Jimenez. Have they gotten to the point to where they should DFA him and cut ties? Jimenez had another lackluster start last night; Jimenez\xe2\x80\x99s line: 1.1 IP, 5 H, 5 R, 2 BB, 0 K.It all begins and ends with starting pitching, so yes they have a decision to make. Anaheim put two runs up in the first inning, however\xc2\xa0Adam Jones homered on the first pitch in the last of the first to cut the lead to 2-1. You thought at that point that the O\xe2\x80\x99s might find a way to stay in the game \xe2\x80\x93 not to be, at the end of the day.Anaheim put three more runs on the board in the second, which of course was an inning in which Jimenez was chased from the game. They brought in\xc2\xa0Mike Wright, who was newly promoted again from Norfolk. And Wright wasn\xe2\x80\x99t much better, which is probably why he was optioned back after the game. By the end of the fourth inning, the O\xe2\x80\x99s trailed 8-1.\xc2\xa0Live Feed ubaldo jimenezBaltimore Orioles: Inconsistent pitching leads to unexpected roster moves The Baltimore WireBaltimore Orioles: Fun facts as the first trip to Yankee Stadium gets underway The Baltimore WireBaltimore Orioles Clicking on All Cylinders The Baltimore WireBaltimore Orioles: What to Make of Recent Stellar Starts by Jimenez, Miley The Baltimore WireBaltimore Orioles: What's next for Ubaldo Jim\xc3\xa9nez? The Baltimore WireBaltimore Orioles vs. Cincinnati Reds: 3 things to keep an eye on The Baltimore WireJonathan Schoop\xc2\xa0would add a solo homer in the last of the fourth, and following another Anaheim run in the sixth\xc2\xa0Mark Trumbo ", 'birdswatcher.com'), ('Baltimore Orioles: Losing Early Means Losing Late', 'Jul 8, 2016; Baltimore, MD, USA; A general view of Oriole Park at Camden Yards during the fifth inning of the game between the Baltimore Orioles and the Los Angeles Angels. Los Angeles Angels defeated Baltimore Orioles 9-5. Mandatory Credit: Tommy Gilligan-USA TODAY SportsThe Baltimore Orioles, despite their overall good record, have allowed too many early runs in games.This is of course symptomatic of a very troubled rotation. And even the better pitchers on the Orioles have a tendency to yield too many first-innings runs (i.e. Chris Tillman).Falling behind early in games puts a great deal of pressure on the offense, though fortunately the Orioles have a lineup that can and does come back. That the Orioles rank among the best couple of teams in the game in come-from-behind wins is not only a statement about the powerful lineup, it also is the product of deficits due to poor starting pitching.The problem appeared again last night, predictably with Ubaldo Jimenez starting. On a night honoring the Orioles\xe2\x80\x99 first World Series Championship team of 50 years ago, it was not a good sign that UJ, in only 1.1 innings of pitching, gave up 2.5 times more runs than the entire pitching staff did in the 1966 Series.This simply has to be the end of the road for Jimenez. The word from the beat writers covering the Orioles is that they are willing to eat the money and let him go. It is time. Heck, it is well past time! In baseball equivalency, we are in about the 15th or 16th inning of patience.Even so, Mike Wright was not categorically better. Scioscia is an attitudinal pain in the derriere to watch hanging over the dugout railing with his chin on folded arms. But can you blame him for being irritated by watching the same pitcher ding three of his guys, including breaking the hand of one of them?At the end of the night, the Orioles went down to defeat 9-5. They did hit three home runs and were only set down in order in one of the nine innings. But the Birds failed to capitalize on opportunities, going 1-for-8 with runners in scoring positions. And you know you\xe2\x80\x99re not destined to win when J.J. Hardy makes errors on back-to-back plays.For the season, the first innings numbers for Baltimore are really quite dreadful. The staff has given up a total of 62 runs, which is equal to 6.56 per nine innings. The O\xe2\x80\x99s offense has scored 46 first inning runs. The only other inning that comes close to these numbers for Baltimore pitching is the sixth, actually worse at a 6.88 per nine innings rate. Of course we have seen this be a difficult transition inning when starters are struggling to truly get deep into the game.If you think it was a rough night for the Birds, the Bowie Baysox had it worse. They dropped a game to the Reading Phillies by a final score of 21-4, giving up all of those runs in the first five innings. Just trying to be like the Big Club, I guess. The Reading team has a record of 62-26, possibly still the best in all levels of baseball. Matthew Grimes \xe2\x80\x93 Carolina League all-star with a 1.69 ERA on the season \xe2\x80\x93 makes his second AA start tonight and will look to cool off the Phillies.Is there any good news anywhere in Orioleland? Actually yes. The Delmarva Shorebirds won last night 5-0 on a no-hitter pitched by Ofelky Peralta. It was rain-shortened to five innings, but it still counts!\xc2\xa0 Peralta is a 19-year-old from the Dominican Republic in his third year and is currently 5-4 with a 3.45 ERA. He gave up only one hit in six innings in his previous start, both of these games being against the first-half champion Hagerstown Suns. More from Baltimore Orioles5/8 - Baltimore Orioles: Matt Wieters Suits Up for His First Game Against Orioles5/8 - Baltimore Orioles Player Profile: Aderlin Rodriguez5/7 - Baltimore Orioles: Chris Tillman\xe2\x80\x99s return was a welcomed one in Baltimore5/7 - Baltimore Orioles: Injury update on Orioles starting pitcher Wade Miley5/6 - Baltimore Orioles Acquire Jordan Kipper from AngelsSo what is the solution for the Orioles to get them to stop losing early, which causes them to lose late when there are too many runs to make up? I don\xe2\x80\x99t know that answer. I don\xe2\x80\x99t see a cure from outside the organization either. I am afraid the need is for several current players to get it together and live up to their potential. ', 'thebaltimorewire.com'), ('Schoop helps Orioles rally past Angels 3-2 - USA TODAY', 'Los Angeles Angels manager Mike Scioscia, second from right, stands in the dugout in the ninth inning of a baseball game against the Baltimore Orioles in Baltimore, Saturday, July 9, 2016. (AP Photo/Patrick Semansky)(Photo: The Associated Press)CONNECTTWEETLINKEDINCOMMENTEMAILMOREBALTIMORE (AP) \xe2\x80\x94 The Baltimore Orioles will stand alone atop the AL East at the All-Star break, thanks to another home run by Mark Trumbo and a comeback fueled by an unusual balk.Jonathan Schoop trotted home with the tying run in the seventh inning and delivered the decisive RBI single in the eighth to carry Baltimore past the Los Angeles Angels 3-2 Saturday.The Orioles have been alone in first place since June 16 and will remain there through the break, which begins after the conclusion of Sunday\'s schedule."Obviously, it\'s the end game we\'re after," manager Buck Showalter said.Right-hander Yovani Gallardo, who allowed two runs in five-plus innings, said, "Being in first place going into the All-Star break, it\'s good. But we all understand we\'ve got a long way to go."Baltimore\'s immediate goal is to hit the break with another victory after splitting the first two games of the series."We\'ve just got to finish strong, then get three days\' rest and come back next half stronger," Schoop said.Trumbo hit his major league leading 28th home run for Baltimore, a solo shot in the second inning. It was the Orioles\' 135th homer of the season, their most before the break.Angels starter Nick Tropeano gave up one run and five hits in six innings, striking out eight. He left with a 2-1 lead, but the bullpen promptly gave it away.After the Orioles got runners to second and third in the seventh against JC Ramirez, Joe Smith (1-4) came in and immediately dropped the ball from the set position for a balk, enabling Schoop to score."I just messed up. That\'s the most embarrassing moment I\'ve ever had on a baseball field," Smith said. "That was 100 percent my fault."In the eighth, Manny Machado and Chris Davis singled before Schoop lined a single to center to bring in the go-ahead run.Brad Brach (6-1) worked the eighth and Zach Britton finished for his 26th save. Both relievers are going to the All-Star Game.Daniel Nava had two RBIs for the Angels, who were bidding for their season-high fifth straight win."We had some opportunities to break the game open," manager Mike Scioscia said. "So obviously, there\'s going to be a spotlight on the balk in the seventh inning, but there\'s a lot of things that led up to that."Limited to three hits over the first five innings, Los Angeles erased a 1-0 deficit in the sixth. Two singles and a walk loaded the bases for Nava, who ripped a two-run single off the right-field scoreboard.Mychal Givens replaced Gallardo and pitched out of a bases-loaded, no-out jam. In the seventh, Givens struck out Mike Trout with two outs and a runner on third.One of the game\'s finest defensive plays occurred in the fifth inning. After Jett Bandy hit a liner off the wall in left-center, Adam Jones barehanded the carom and zipped a throw to second base for the out. Andrelton Simmons followed with an inconsequential single.STREAKYAngels: Simmons extended his hitting streak to 11 games. ... Yunel Escobar\'s hitting streak ended at 13 games.Orioles: Brach extended his scoreless streak to 10 games and 12 2/3 innings. ... Schoop has hit safely in eight straight games and 19 of his last 20.TRAINER\'S ROOMAngels: C.J. Cron was placed on the DL late Friday with a fractured left hand, so Ji-Man Choi and Jefry Marte will split time at 1B, Scioscia said.Orioles: Setup man Darren O\'Day (right hamstring strain) will throw on flat ground Sunday. There is no timetable for his return. "We need to get him back," Showalter said. "He completes the bullpen."UP NEXTAngels: Tim Lincecum (1-2, 7.50 ERA) wraps up the first half Sunday by making his fifth start since signing with LA on May 20.Orioles: Chris Tillman (11-2, 3.55) can surpass his win total of the 2015 season with a victory in the series finale.CONNECTTWEETLINKEDINCOMMENTEMAILMORECopyright 2016 The Associated Press. All rights reserved. This material may not be published, broadcast, rewritten or redistributed. ', 'www.usatoday.com')]

[("Baltimore Orioles: Jonathan Schoop is balked to Birds' win", "Jonathan Schoop scored the tying run for the Baltimore Orioles on a balk, and later plated the winning run in the Birds\xe2\x80\x99 3-2 win over Anaheim.Jonathan Schoop and the Baltimore Orioles will take wins however they can get them. Every team in every sprt will \xe2\x80\x93 it\xe2\x80\x99s part of the business (of sports). Sometimes you win games or you get breaks in strange ways. If you sit there and wonder how it\xe2\x80\x99s possible you could have caught such a strange break, the moment will pass you by.Yovani Gallardo gave the Orioles five fairly solid innings, although he probably nibbled on the corners a bit too much. In effect, that drove up his pitch count which probably led to an earlier exit than both he and the coaches would have liked. Gallardo\xe2\x80\x99s line: 5.0 IP, 2 R, 1 BB, 8 K.Obviously with eight strike outs it\xe2\x80\x99s tough to say that Gallardo wasn\xe2\x80\x99t throwing strikes. But there were times when he tried to get a little too \xe2\x80\x9ccute\xe2\x80\x9d on the outer fringes of the strike zone, and when those pitches weren\xe2\x80\x99t called strikes he\xe2\x80\x99d get down in counts. But all in all, he put the team in a spot to win and that\xe2\x80\x99s really all you can ask.\xc2\xa0Live Feed jonathan schoopBaltimore Orioles execute a weird triple play on Boston Red Sox FanSidedBaltimore Orioles Clicking on All Cylinders The Baltimore WireBaltimore Orioles Second Baseman Jonathan Schoop is Sizzling at the Plate The Baltimore WireBaltimore Orioles: How long can one of the best infields in the league stay together? The Baltimore WireBaltimore Orioles: A walk is as good as a hit, unless you're batting for Birdland The Baltimore WireBaltimore Orioles: 2017 MLB season preview FanSidedThe Birds took a 1-0 lead in the last of the second on yet another\xc2\xa0Mark Trumbo home run. If they handed out MVP awards for the first half of the season, Trumbo would be a prime candidate.\xc2\xa0Dan Duquette trading a triple-A catcher for Trumbo might be one of the most lopsided trades in some time this past off season.However Gallardo started to tire in the sixth inning, and he loaded the bases (with nobody out) as his pitch count went up. Nava\xe2\x80\x99s two-RBI single gave Anaheim a 2-1 lead, and chased Gallardo from the game. As I said, while he tired at the end of his outing, Gallardo still left the team in a spot to win. Being down one run is easily something that can be overcome.However it took something out of the twilight zone for that the begin to happen. With two runners in scoring position\xc2\xa0(including Jonathan Schoop at third base) and one out in the last of the seventh Anaheim had Smith pitching to\xc2\xa0Adam Jones. It was one of those at-bats where the crowd started to come to life and you felt there was a chance of something special happening\xe2\x80\xa6More from Editorials/Analysis2/20 - Baltimore Orioles: Previewing the 2017 Season2/18 - Baltimore Orioles: How safe is Joey Rickard\xe2\x80\x99s spot on the roster?2/15 - Baltimore Orioles: Time to snap up Jorge De La Rosa?2/13 - Baltimore Orioles: Nevada Sportsbooks Betting on a 2017 Decline1/30 - Baltimore Orioles: Craig Breslow is an intriguing name for the Orioles to consider\xe2\x80\xa6and in fact, something special did happen. Just not what anyone would have imagined. As he wound up to pitch to Jones, Smith literally just dropped the ball. As in it fell out of his hand. A balk was immediately called, and Schoop was awarded home plate \xe2\x80\x93 tying the game. One inning later, it was an RBI-single off the bat of Schoop which ended up giving the Orioles a 3-2 lead which turned into a 3-2 victory.I\xe2\x80\x99ve seen the ball fall out of a pitcher\xe2\x80\x99s hand before; it\xe2\x80\x99s not unique to this game. However I\xe2\x80\x99m not sure I\xe2\x80\x99ve seen it happen in a spot that big in a game. You have to feel somewhat badly for Smith. Ironically,\xc2\xa0Buck Showalter had similar thoughts on the matter after the game, and he seemed in favor of not even calling that a balk (quote courtesy of Roch Kubatko, MASNsports):In the whole scheme of things, I\xe2\x80\x99m all about fairness. What advantage was he trying to gain? The balk, to me, I wish we\xe2\x80\x99d re-examine it. Because a guy drops the ball or doesn\xe2\x80\x99t step off at the exact time, what advantage is he trying to gain?\xe2\x80\x9cI see a balk when you\xe2\x80\x99re trying to keep a guy from stealing second or you\xe2\x80\x99re able to pick him off with a bent knee move or whatever, but if you really break it down \xe2\x80\xa6 I like to think we\xe2\x80\x99d have figured out a way anyway. That\xe2\x80\x99s not to say something different would have happened, but I\xe2\x80\x99ve always felt that way about balks. If some guy doesn\xe2\x80\x99t come to a complete stop with a man on third and two outs, come on.Obviously he\xe2\x80\x99s not arguing about getting the run in that spot, but I thought it was an interesting thing to say. At the end of the day, sometimes you need a strange occurance or two like that to go in your favor over the course of the season in order to win games.\xc2\xa0Next: Baltimore Orioles: Eat the rest of Ubaldo Jimenez's contract?The O\xe2\x80\x99s will close the series and the first half of the season this afternoon at Camden Yards.\xc2\xa0Chris Tillman will be on the mound for the Birds, and he\xe2\x80\x99ll be opposed by Anaheim\xe2\x80\x99s\xc2\xa0Tim Lincecum. Game time is set for just after 1:30 PM. ", 'birdswatcher.com'), ('Orioles Game 87 Game Thread: vs. Angels, 1:35 - Camden Chat', " It is the final game of the unofficial \xe2\x80\x9cfirst half\xe2\x80\x9d of the 2016 MLB season. It would be great to see the Orioles go out on a high note, win their 51st game of the season, take the series from the Angels and go into the All-Star break with a smile.    On paper, it sure feels like they should be able to do that. Chris Tillman reasserted himself last time out, and Tim Lincecum is looking very much \xe2\x80\x9cover the hill\xe2\x80\x9d. In addition, the fans HAVE to be pumped for the Adam Jones JUMBO baseball card giveaway, right? Eh. Some quick notes from O\xe2\x80\x99s Twitter:      ODay still not sure when will throw off mound. Said hamstring feels better.  Headed to Sarasota during break #orioles\xe2\x80\x94 Roch Kubatko (@masnRoch) July 10, 2016      Mark Trumbo's 28 homers is tied for 3rd most by an O at AS break (1 to go). Brady Anderson 30 in 1996 & Chris Davis 37 in 2013.\xe2\x80\x94 Steve Melewski (@masnSteve) July 10, 2016      Trumbo's HR was the Orioles 135th HR before the All-Star break. New club record, previous 134 in 1996.\xe2\x80\x94 Steve Melewski (@masnSteve) July 9, 2016       Today's Lineups     LOS ANGELES ANGELS BALTIMORE ORIOLES     Yunel Escobar - 3B Adam Jones - CF   Kole Calhoun - RF Hyun Soo Kim - LF   Mike Trout - CF Manny Machado - 3B   Albert Pujols - DH Mark Trumbo - RF   Jefry Marte - 1B Chris Davis - 1B   Ji-Man Choi - LF Matt Wieters - C   Andrelton Simmons - SS Jonathan Schoop - 2B   Geovany Soto - C Pedro Alvarez - DH   Gregorio Petit - 2B J.J. Hardy - SS       Tim Lincecum - RHP Chris Tillman - RHP         ", 'www.camdenchat.com'), ('Schoop helps Orioles rally past Angels 3-2 - yahoo.com', "View photosBaltimore Orioles' Manny Machado, center, points to teammate Jonathan Schoop (not shown) after scoring the go-ahead run on Schoop's single in the eighth inning of a baseball game against the Los Angeles Angels in Baltimore, Saturday, July 9, 2016. (AP Photo/Patrick Semansky)MoreBALTIMORE (AP) -- The Baltimore Orioles will stand alone atop the AL East at the All-Star break, thanks to another home run by Mark Trumbo and a comeback fueled by an unusual balk.Jonathan Schoop trotted home with the tying run in the seventh inning and delivered the decisive RBI single in the eighth to carry Baltimore past the Los Angeles Angels 3-2 Saturday.The Orioles have been alone in first place since June 16 and will remain there through the break, which begins after the conclusion of Sunday's schedule.''Obviously, it's the end game we're after,'' manager Buck Showalter said.Right-hander Yovani Gallardo, who allowed two runs in five-plus innings, said, ''Being in first place going into the All-Star break, it's good. But we all understand we've got a long way to go.''Baltimore's immediate goal is to hit the break with another victory after splitting the first two games of the series.''We've just got to finish strong, then get three days' rest and come back next half stronger,'' Schoop said.Trumbo hit his major league leading 28th home run for Baltimore, a solo shot in the second inning. It was the Orioles' 135th homer of the season, their most before the break.Angels starter Nick Tropeano gave up one run and five hits in six innings, striking out eight. He left with a 2-1 lead, but the bullpen promptly gave it away.After the Orioles got runners to second and third in the seventh against JC Ramirez, Joe Smith (1-4) came in and immediately dropped the ball from the set position for a balk, enabling Schoop to score.''I just messed up. That's the most embarrassing moment I've ever had on a baseball field,'' Smith said. ''That was 100 percent my fault.''In the eighth, Manny Machado and Chris Davis singled before Schoop lined a single to center to bring in the go-ahead run.Brad Brach (6-1) worked the eighth and Zach Britton finished for his 26th save. Both relievers are going to the All-Star Game.Daniel Nava had two RBIs for the Angels, who were bidding for their season-high fifth straight win.''We had some opportunities to break the game open,'' manager Mike Scioscia said. ''So obviously, there's going to be a spotlight on the balk in the seventh inning, but there's a lot of things that led up to that.''Limited to three hits over the first five innings, Los Angeles erased a 1-0 deficit in the sixth. Two singles and a walk loaded the bases for Nava, who ripped a two-run single off the right-field scoreboard.Mychal Givens replaced Gallardo and pitched out of a bases-loaded, no-out jam. In the seventh, Givens struck out Mike Trout with two outs and a runner on third.One of the game's finest defensive plays occurred in the fifth inning. After Jett Bandy hit a liner off the wall in left-center, Adam Jones barehanded the carom and zipped a throw to second base for the out. Andrelton Simmons followed with an inconsequential single.STREAKYAngels: Simmons extended his hitting streak to 11 games. ... Yunel Escobar's hitting streak ended at 13 games.Orioles: Brach extended his scoreless streak to 10 games and 12 2/3 innings. ... Schoop has hit safely in eight straight games and 19 of his last 20.TRAINER'S ROOMAngels: C.J. Cron was placed on the DL late Friday with a fractured left hand, so Ji-Man Choi and Jefry Marte will split time at 1B, Scioscia said.Orioles: Setup man Darren O'Day (right hamstring strain) will throw on flat ground Sunday. There is no timetable for his return. ''We need to get him back,'' Showalter said. ''He completes the bullpen.''UP NEXTAngels: Tim Lincecum (1-2, 7.50 ERA) wraps up the first half Sunday by making his fifth start since signing with LA on May 20.Orioles: Chris Tillman (11-2, 3.55) can surpass his win total of the 2015 season with a victory in the series finale. ", 'www.yahoo.com')]

[('Baltimore Orioles: A Solid First Half of 2016', 'The Baltimore Orioles finished the first half of the 2016 season with a solid 4-2 win over the Angels, securing first place at the break.But even with a 51-36 record and American League East lead of two games over the Blue Jays and Red Sox, Orioles fans have an ongoing sense of hanging by a thread. It is the terribly unreliable starting rotation that feeds this feeling, even as the O\xe2\x80\x99s have proven there is more than one way to winning baseball games.Much about the Sunday game was a microcosm of the first half. Chris Tillman\xe2\x80\x99s start will look a lot better on paper than it did in person (and I was at the game on this occasion). Though he held the damage to only a single run in the first inning, there were five walks and a lot of hard-hit balls and deep flyouts. It isn\xe2\x80\x99t always pretty, but somehow the job gets done and the victories outnumber the losses.The Orioles scored three of their four runs on home runs, another prominent trend of the 2016 season. Chris Davis brought the O\xe2\x80\x99s back from an early 1-0 deficit with an opposite field home run, while J.J. Hardy gave them a valuable insurance run in the eighth inning with a screaming liner to left field.\xc2\xa0 He also had a previous clutch RBI hit for the Birds\xe2\x80\x99 third run. Hitting out of the ninth hole is, in my estimation, the place for Hardy in the lineup. There he can so some serious damage in driving in runs while also turning over the batting order.Fellow All-Star relievers Brad Brach and Zach Britton did their final two-inning, one-two punch. But they had some balls squared up on them a bit and have not seemed as dominating in recent outings. Showalter said of Tillman that he was glad the pitcher was not going to the All-Star game. I would wish that for all the O\xe2\x80\x99s players. Other than helping to gain a possible World Series home field advantage, there is little to gain and a lot to lose. The break would do them much good. And Mark Trumbo will be swinging for the fences, while we hope this does not mess up his swing as it had with others in the past. More from Baltimore Orioles5/8 - Baltimore Orioles: Matt Wieters Suits Up for His First Game Against Orioles5/8 - Baltimore Orioles Player Profile: Aderlin Rodriguez5/7 - Baltimore Orioles: Chris Tillman\xe2\x80\x99s return was a welcomed one in Baltimore5/7 - Baltimore Orioles: Injury update on Orioles starting pitcher Wade Miley5/6 - Baltimore Orioles Acquire Jordan Kipper from AngelsNot many baseball writers would have predicted the Orioles to be in first place at this point of the season. And they still don\xe2\x80\x99t speak of them even now as serious contenders very often even now. So it is hard to fault a team with 51 wins, on pace for a 95-win season.The power has been impressive, as hoped for though certainly not guaranteed. Baltimore is on pace for a 255-home run season. That is close to record-breaking \xe2\x80\xa6MLB All-Time HRsO\xe2\x80\x99s All-Time HRsO\xe2\x80\x99s 2016 Pace264 (Seattle- \xe2\x80\x9897)257 (\xe2\x80\x9896)255MLB All-Time K\xe2\x80\x99sO\xe2\x80\x99s All-time K\xe2\x80\x99sO\xe2\x80\x99s 2016 Pace1553 (Hous.- \xe2\x80\x9813)1331 (\xe2\x80\x9815)1382\xc2\xa0So the Orioles are clearly ahead of their own franchise pace strikeouts, though they will be short of any all-time record.But all in all, this is a first place team whether we think they can stay there on not. We would have all jumped with joy in March if we knew that the Baltimore Orioles would be 51-36 at this juncture of the season. ', 'thebaltimorewire.com'), ('Baltimore Orioles: Chris Tillman finishes the first half ...', "The Baltimore Orioles hit the all-star break in first place by two games after a strong victory by Chris Tillman against Anaheim.It begins and ends with starting pitching; and the Baltimore Orioles got a decent effort by\xc2\xa0Chris Tillman in the final game of the unofficial first half of the season yesterday. Tillman\xe2\x80\x99s line: 7.0 IP, 3 H, 1 R, 5 BB, 5 K. As manager\xc2\xa0Buck Showalter said after the game, Tillman wasn\xe2\x80\x99t happy about the five walks. But the Orioles overcame that and were able to find ways out of those situations.Tillman stands at 12-2 at the all-star break, and he\xe2\x80\x99s looked good in his last two starts in obtaining that record. It\xe2\x80\x99s almost a shame that Tillman looked so good yesterday in one sense. Yesterday being the final game before the all-star break, the bullpen was going to get a few days\xe2\x80\x99 worth of rest to begin with. If this was a normal game going into another week we could have said that Tillman did a good service by his bullpen by going so deep into the game!The lone run that Tillman surrendered came in the wake of one of the walks he issued \xe2\x80\x93 right off the bat in the first inning. Trout\xe2\x80\x99s triple gave Calhoun (who had walked) a chance to scored from first. In a dramatic play at the plate, he appeared to have been thrown out. But Anaheim asked for a review \xe2\x80\x93 and the call was overturned, leaving the O\xe2\x80\x99s trailing 1-0.\xc2\xa0Live Feed chris tillmanBaltimore Orioles: Chris Tillman season debut scheduled for Sunday Call to the PenBaltimore Orioles: The key piece in making the six-man bullpen work The Baltimore WireBaltimore Orioles: Kevin Gausman is trying to get back on track The Baltimore WireBaltimore Orioles: What to Make of Recent Stellar Starts by Jimenez, Miley The Baltimore WireBaltimore Orioles: Is five straight quality starts too much to ask for? The Baltimore WireBlue Jays Easter Optimism Jays JournalSo here\xe2\x80\x99s my issue with the review; it took almost three minutes for the umpires to rule the runner safe. On one hand you do appreciate the thoroughness of the job that they did in reviewing the play. However it\xe2\x80\x99s worth saying that if it takes that long it might well be inconclusive at best. Keep in mind that they have to see \xe2\x80\x9cindisputable evidence to overturn the call on the field.\xe2\x80\x9d That\xe2\x80\x99s the standard, as opposed to having to see an angle where \xe2\x80\x9cin theory the runner\xc2\xa0could have touched home plate.\xe2\x80\x9d If it takes more than two minutes, it\xe2\x80\x99s worth mentioning that maybe there\xe2\x80\x99s no indisputable evidence.Nevertheless, with the firepower in the Orioles\xe2\x80\x99 lineup being down 1-0 after one inning isn\xe2\x80\x99t a back-breaker. The Birds trailed until the fourth inning, in which\xc2\xa0Chris Davis sent a deep shot the opposite way into the left field grandstand for a two-run homer. You really saw Davis\xe2\x80\x99 power on that shot, as it went the other way and it landed almost at the top of the grandstand. The left fielder barely even moved because he knew it was gone from the beginning.Two innings later\xc2\xa0Pedro Alvarez hit a shallow blooper to left field, for what appeared to be the final out of the inning. However in a moment of miscommunication, Anaheim somehow allowed it to drop. To make matters worse for them, they airmailed the throw to second base \xe2\x80\x93 at the end of the day, Alvarez ended up at third. He would score a moment later on\xc2\xa0J.J. Hardy\xe2\x80\x98s RBI-single, and the O\xe2\x80\x99s held a 3-1 lead.\xc2\xa0More from Orioles News2/20 - Baltimore Orioles: Adding Vidal Nuno helps fill out bullpen2/19 - Baltimore Orioles: Manny Machado and O\xe2\x80\x99s have not discussed extension2/19 - Baltimore Orioles: O\xe2\x80\x99s receive good news about J.J. Hardy\xe2\x80\x99s back2/19 - Baltimore Orioles: Orioles sign Craig Gentry to minor-league deal2/17 - Baltimore Orioles: Chris Johnson wants to revitalize his careerAnaheim would inch closer in the eighth on a sac fly-RBI by Pujols, however Hardy\xe2\x80\x99s solo homer in the last of the inning all but sealed the game for the O\xe2\x80\x99s. They ended the first half on a high note, taking two-of-three from Anaheim before the team dispersed around the country for the break. The O\xe2\x80\x99s also finished the first half in first place by two games in the American League East.The only downside to this game was that\xc2\xa0Hyun-Soo Kim had to leave the game after the first inning with a hamstring injury. Buck Showalter said after the game that he injured his hamstring last year right before the all-star break in his previous league as well, and was back playing a few days later. So we\xe2\x80\x99ll just have to see if he\xe2\x80\x99s ready to go on Friday in Tampa.\xc2\xa0Next: Baltimore Orioles: Jonathan Schoop is balked to a Birds' winAs I said, the O\xe2\x80\x99s now disperse around the country for some well-deserved time off. The team charter will leave from Baltimore for Tampa on Thursday night, but until then players will have the opportunity to take a few days off \xe2\x80\x93 before a stretch run for the AL East pennant, that is. ", 'birdswatcher.com')]

[('American League wins World Series home field for Orioles ...', ' As it ended up, the most noteworthy thing about the 2016 All-Star Game for Orioles fans is that Major League Baseball screwed Baltimore out of getting to host this year\xe2\x80\x99s edition of the game as punishment for carrying on the fight in the MASN case.    If that\xe2\x80\x99s a new story to you, check out this article from Baseball Prospectus last year which makes the strong suggestion that the Orioles were all lined up to host this year\xe2\x80\x99s game until suddenly they weren\xe2\x80\x99t. The belief that the MASN fight and the Orioles not hosting are connected was stated directly by a couple of people around baseball during tonight\xe2\x80\x99s game. The next most noteworthy thing is that the American League won the contest, 4-2, with Zach Britton picking up the save, so if the Orioles do somehow make it to the World Series, that means that the first two games and games 6 and 7 would be hosted in Baltimore. There\xe2\x80\x99s a lot of baseball between now and then. Other than that, there really wasn\xe2\x80\x99t much to talk about. The three Orioles batters, Manny Machado, Matt Wieters, and Mark Trumbo, combined to go 0-6, with only Trumbo reaching base at all, and that only because of a fielding error. Machado only saw six pitches in three at-bats.    There was one amusing play in the field for Machado. In the fifth inning, Colorado\xe2\x80\x99s Nolan Arenado hit a lazy ground ball towards shortstop with a runner already on first base. Red Sox shortstop Xander Bogaerts, who is a poor man\xe2\x80\x99s Machado, stood his ground and waited for the ball to roll to him.    Machado did not feel like waiting around for the ball, so he cut over from his third base position to get in front of the ball, field it, and flip to second base to get the lead runner. Bogaerts, waiting on the ball, could have probably only gotten an out at first. This may have saved a run for the AL squad as the next batter, Wil Myers, hit a double that was not able to score Arenado from first, even with two outs.    Britton\xe2\x80\x99s ninth inning saw him record three outs on three ground balls, which is what he tends to do in regular games too. One of them snuck through the infield. Another was a comebacker to Britton that he didn\xe2\x80\x99t field quickly enough to turn a double play. The third was a game-ending double play. The fifth Orioles All-Star, Brad Brach, did not get into the game, although he did at least get up and warm when Blue Jays starter Aaron Sanchez ran into a little bit of trouble in the fourth inning. As for the rest of the game, all four American League runs were driven in by two Royals players, Eric Hosmer and Salvador Perez. Each one homered in the second inning. Hosmer also had an RBI single in the third inning. He was named MVP of the game.    There will now be two days with no baseball. We will make it through this somehow. The good news is that the Orioles will be in first place the whole time.  ', 'www.camdenchat.com'), ("Baltimore Orioles' Mark Trumbo bows out in the semis", 'Mark Trumbo of the Baltimore Orioles was the top seed in the 2016 Home Run Derby at the MLB All-Star game, but bowed out in the semi-finals.Mark Trumbo of the Baltimore Orioles knew that the competition was going to be stiff in the 2016 Home Run Derby at the MLB All-Star game. Heck, with Miami\xe2\x80\x99s\xc2\xa0Giancarlo Stanton in the competition (the eventual champion) it was almost a race for second place if anything. Trumbo bowed out to Stanton in the semi-finals, but he certainly ended up with a strong showing.Trumbo was the only participant to hit the scoreboard at Petco Park. He also hit a couple of balls onto rooftops in the stadium complex. It\xe2\x80\x99s interesting to note that the Orioles were just in San Diego two weeks ago at the beginning of their west coast trip. So maybe that helped Trumbo to get familiar with the confines.As I said above, you knew that the competition would be stiff with Stanton in the sweepstakes. I\xe2\x80\x99m reminded of the one year at the NBA All-Star game when Larry Bird walked into the locker room before the three-point contest and wondered aloud who would be placing second. Obviously the implication was that Bird (who incidentally is my favorite NBA player of all time) would be placing first \xe2\x80\x93 which he did. Stanton didn\xe2\x80\x99t say anything along those lines, however everyone knows the type of hitter he is.\xc2\xa0Live Feed mark trumboBaltimore Orioles: While slumping, a drop in the lineup may be beneficial for Trumbo The Baltimore WireIs Major League Baseball in need of a face? FanSidedWhat should the Baltimore Orioles do with their crowded outfield? The Baltimore WireBaltimore Orioles flip script in thrilling win to kick off 2017 season The Baltimore WireMLB Opening Day 2017 starts with home run bang FanSidedBaltimore Orioles Opening Day 2017: Trumbo blasts walk-off homer in extra innings The Baltimore WireTrumbo launched 16 home runs, including eight straight, to get to the semi-finals, where he hit 14 to Stanton\xe2\x80\x99s 17. Trumbo\xe2\x80\x99s longest home run of the competition was in the first round, and it traveled 479 feet. Not too shabby if you think about it.Obviously the only concern from the Orioles\xe2\x80\x99 standpoint is that somehow participating in this messes with Trumbo\xe2\x80\x99s swing in some manner. While it\xe2\x80\x99s rare for a slugger to totally fall off the map in the second half, sometimes that can in fact happen. My personal opinion is that the whole concept of potential injury or messed up mechanics as a result of particiating in all-star festivities is overblown.\xc2\xa0More from Orioles News2/20 - Baltimore Orioles: Adding Vidal Nuno helps fill out bullpen2/19 - Baltimore Orioles: Manny Machado and O\xe2\x80\x99s have not discussed extension2/19 - Baltimore Orioles: O\xe2\x80\x99s receive good news about J.J. Hardy\xe2\x80\x99s back2/19 - Baltimore Orioles: Orioles sign Craig Gentry to minor-league deal2/17 - Baltimore Orioles: Chris Johnson wants to revitalize his careerAt the end of the day however, athletes are very particular about mechanics so maybe there\xe2\x80\x99s something to that. While I certainly do understand that in many cases players might prefer to get the couple of days off during the break and that many coaches would prefer that they do also, I tend to think that if I were an athlete I\xe2\x80\x99d see it as an honor to be a part of the all-star festivities. But hey, that\xe2\x80\x99s just me!\xc2\xa0Next: Baltimore Orioles: Chris Tillman finishes the first half strongTrumbo and the rest of both his Orioles and American League teammates will now turn their attention to the all-star game itself. First pitch is this evening at 7:30 EST. ', 'birdswatcher.com')]

                    });                 });             }          } })();  The All-Star break is traditionally a time to step back and judge how teams are doing. But rather than looking at the standings, it may be more instructive to compare each team with its expectations before the season began.Bovada, like many oddsmakers, posted an over/under total for each team in March, a guess on how many games each team would win. Oddsmakers usually know what they are talking about. The three teams expected to slip the most this year \xe2\x80\x94 the Cardinals, the Pirates and the Royals \xe2\x80\x94 are all running well behind their winning percentages from last season. Three teams expected to improve significantly \xe2\x80\x94 the Red Sox, the Marlins and the Tigers \xe2\x80\x94 have all done so.Therefore, it seems perfectly fair to judge teams on a curve of sorts. It matters less if you are good or bad, and more on whether you are an overachiever or an underachiever.First, the top grades.3. Texas Rangers, 54-36, projects to 97 wins. Over/under: 84.5.Texas was a solid 88-74 last season and made the playoffs. But the Astros were the popular pick to win the American League West this season, in part because Texas lost starter Yovani Gallardo to the Orioles in free agency. Instead, the Rangers have raced to the best record in the league and a five-and-a-half-game division lead. Cole Hamels is 9-2, and Ian Desmond is hitting .322 with 15 homers. While no one has most valuable player numbers, almost no key player is not pulling his weight. Continue reading the main story        Advertisement  Continue reading the main story      One concern is that the Rangers\xe2\x80\x99 run differential is only third in the division, trailing the Mariners and the Astros, a sign that some above-average luck has helped the team so far.  Advertisement  Continue reading the main story  2. San Francisco Giants, 57-33, projects to 103 wins. Over/under: 89.5.The Giants were 84-78 last year and fell eight games short of the playoffs. Improvement was expected this season from those who were entranced by the one-two pitching punch of Madison Bumgarner and Johnny Cueto, the nine-figure free-agent signing . They were right. Bumgarner is 10-4 and Cueto 13-1, and the Giants have the best record in baseball.1. Baltimore Orioles, 51-36, projects to 95 wins. Over/under: 79.5.Although the Orioles are not having as great a season as the Giants, the curve thrusts them to the top of the table. While the Giants were expected to be a solid winning team, Baltimore was expected to be thoroughly mediocre. Last year the Orioles were 81-81, and their pitching staff for this season was seen as particularly thin. The tough A.L. East was also seen as a hurdle.But behind Chris Tillman (12-2) and Mark Trumbo (a startling major-league-leading 28 home runs), the Orioles are leading the A.L. East.  Advertisement  Continue reading the main story  Before you buy playoff tickets, consider that like the Rangers, the Orioles\xe2\x80\x99 run differential is weak, third in the division behind the highly fancied Blue Jays and the Red Sox, who are each only two games back. Privacy Policy    Now the more embarrassing list, baseball\xe2\x80\x99s biggest underachievers. There are plenty to choose from.  Advertisement  Continue reading the main story  Missing are the Atlanta Braves, at 31-58 the worst team in the game. Their manager, Fredi Gonzalez, was the first one fired this season, with the team\xe2\x80\x99s record at 9-28. But the Braves are a more respectable 22-30 since. And a bad Braves team was expected anyway: Their over/under was 66.5, the worst of any team but the Phillies (65.5). So while their projection of 56 wins is bad, the team is not underachieving badly enough to make the top three.  Advertisement  Continue reading the main story  Another team you might expect to see here is Kansas City, which has fallen from a World Series title to barely above .500. But oddsmakers have never liked the Royals very much, and gave them an over/under of only 85.5. The Cardinals, who had the best record in baseball at 100-62 last season, are only 46-42. But oddsmakers correctly guessed they would fall off, giving them an over/under of only 87.5 because of the losses of John Lackey and Jason Heyward to the rival Cubs in free agency.3. Arizona Diamondbacks, 38-52, projects to 68 wins. Over/under 82.5.Take a team just below .500 and add Zack Greinke, and you should get a winning team, right? What if Paul Goldschmidt continues to kill the ball and Jake Lamb has a breakthrough season? Despite these good things, Arizona is a mess. Greinke started well, but is now on the disabled list, and no other regular starter has a winning record; despite a 7.14 E.R.A., Shelby Miller has been given 14 starts. Reports are swirling that the Diamondbacks are going to give up on the season and trade Greinke.2. Los Angeles Angels, 37-52, projects to 67 wins. Over/under 81.5.After an 85-77 season last year, last place in the A.L. West looks pretty bad. Mike Trout is hitting great, as usual, but receiving little support, and the pitching has been shaky. Injuries have hit hard, too.  Advertisement  Continue reading the main story  1. Minnesota Twins, 32-56, projects to 59 wins. Over/under 78.5.The Twins\xe2\x80\x99 offense has been about average, but the pitching has been bad, giving up the most runs in the American League. Ervin Santana (3-7. 4.06) is the best starter; the rest are all on the wrong side of a 5.00 E.R.A.  Last year at this time, the Twins were flying high. At 49-40, they were baseball\xe2\x80\x99s biggest overachievers.  Advertisement  Continue reading the main story  It hasn\xe2\x80\x99t been a great 365 days of baseball in the Twin Cities.  A version of this article appears in print on July 13, 2016, on Page B11 of the New York edition with the headline: These Teams  Defied Expectations,  Both Good and Bad.
