[('Orioles offense gets worse than it already was in 1-0 loss ...', ' Just when you think you\xe2\x80\x99ve surely seen the worst possible Orioles offensive performance you could possibly see, they show up in another game to prove you wrong. The Orioles dredged up the harbor once again to allow access to their increasingly large fail boat.    The game the Orioles turned in against the Athletics, which they lost, 1-0, was nothing short of pathetic. That\xe2\x80\x99s the biggest story in a game where Oakland\xe2\x80\x99s starter, Ross Detwiler, who last won a game as an MLB starter in 2013, was allowed to go eight shutout innings. He had never, in a career spanning 76 starts, gone eight innings - until tonight. Why are they so bad right now? Perhaps it\xe2\x80\x99s just an anomaly, or something they\xe2\x80\x99re having a harder time getting out of because they\xe2\x80\x99re out on the west coast. Whatever it is, they better figure it out in a hurry, because they\xe2\x80\x99ve now lost first place to the Toronto Blue Jays and they will fall farther if they don\xe2\x80\x99t start scoring runs. What makes this game even worse is that, by getting only six hits and no walks against Detwiler, the Orioles spoiled a rare good game from Yovani Gallardo. The guy gave up only a run over six innings, which is very good for him.     The A\xe2\x80\x99s only picked up four hits and two walks against Gallardo, and they only had two at-bats with a runner in scoring position for the whole game, but that was all they needed. With two outs in the third inning, Gallardo gave up back-to-back doubles hit by Marcus Semien and Manny Machado\xe2\x80\x99s brother-in-law. That crossed the lone run of the game.    As it ended up, the O\xe2\x80\x99s had more chances in the game than the Athletics. They went 1-5 with RISP and even that one hit did not score a run. The O\xe2\x80\x99s best, and really only, scoring chance came in the first inning. Adam Jones led off the game with a single and ended up on second base for J.J. Hardy. As Hardy has done a lot lately, he lifted a ball to right field and doubled.    You might ask, how in the world does a guy not score from second base when the batter doubles. That is a great question. The answer is in this video of the play. Actually, I still don\xe2\x80\x99t know the answer and I watched the video.  Even if Jones got a bad read on the ball, A\xe2\x80\x99s right fielder Danny Valencia still bumbles playing the carom and bobbles the pickup. And even considering those screwups, Jones still beat the ball to home plate, except he managed to slide into home plate without actually touching home with his front foot.  Jones was initially called safe. The play was overturned on review. So the Orioles lost a 1-0 game in which they had a run on the board in the first inning except for three baserunning screwups on the same play. When things are going bad, they really go bad.    Find something else in the world to make you happy because it\xe2\x80\x99s sure not going to be the Orioles doing it right now. They\xe2\x80\x99ve performed just about as poorly as you can possibly perform at the plate without getting no-hit against three mediocre-or-worse pitchers over the last three games. Chris Davis got two hits in this game, so I guess that\xe2\x80\x99s something. Former Orioles farmhand Andrew Triggs awaits in the 3:35 series finale on Thursday, which the O\xe2\x80\x99s will be trying to win to avoid being swept by a last place team that could barely be trying harder to lose. Triggs is 27 and has one MLB start under his belt. Perhaps that no-hitter is coming after all. Chris Tillman starts the finale for the Orioles and will be the latest victim of the O\xe2\x80\x99s offense going to sleep on the west coast. The Orioles have gotten six straight quality starts, for crying out loud, and they have lost four of those games. Good grief.  ', 'www.camdenchat.com'), ('Baltimore Orioles: Inconsistency mars Oriole bats of late', "The Baltimore Orioles have seemingly been either poor or inconsistent at the plate since the all-star break. Can they get it back together?Given that the Ravens open up their preseason slate tonight, I suspect that there are a lot of Baltimore Orioles fans wondering if the season is over. Yeah, now\xe2\x80\xa6in August. My response to that is\xc2\xa0NO. Granted that with last night\xe2\x80\x99s 1-0 loss in Oakland Toronto is now in first place, however the Birds are a game out. So nothing\xe2\x80\x99s said and done yet.However since the all-star break the Orioles have struggled at the plate \xe2\x80\x93 of all places. In July I would submit that the bats were silent. Now come August, they\xe2\x80\x99ve progressed just a bit to inconsistent.\xc2\xa0Ironically through all of this, the starting pitching has become very consistent;\xc2\xa0Yovani Gallardo gave the Orioles yet another quality start last night. Gallardo\xe2\x80\x99s line: 6.0 IP, 4 H, 1 R, 2 BB, 6 K.An Alonso RBI-double was the lone run allowed by Gallardo. However when the bats can\xe2\x80\x99t get it together, that\xe2\x80\x99s all you need. And as I stated above, the Birds fell 1-0 and have now dropped three straight (in Oakland).\xc2\xa0Live Feed baltimore oriolesBaltimore Orioles: Chris Tillman's return was a welcomed one in Baltimore The Baltimore WireBaltimore Orioles: Injury update on Orioles starting pitcher Wade Miley The Baltimore WireCurt Schilling Continues to be an Embarrassment Call to the PenBaltimore Orioles: Chris Tillman season debut scheduled for Sunday Call to the PenFantasy Baseball 2017: Zach Britton back on 10-day DL Fantasy Baseball CrackerjacksBaltimore Orioles Acquire Jordan Kipper from Angels The Baltimore WireI\xe2\x80\x99ve been telling fans who write into this column all season that if the offense continues to put up runs the way they are capable of doing, the starting pitching depth won\xe2\x80\x99t matter as much. And it\xe2\x80\x99s a situation like what we\xe2\x80\x99re seeing now which attests as to why I offered that qualifier \xc2\xa0in terms of the O\xe2\x80\x99s staying in the race\xe2\x80\xa6if the offense continues to put up numbers.Now I do maintain that you have to look at the overall track record \xe2\x80\x93 both as individuals and as a team. There\xe2\x80\x99s nobody out there who would dare suggest that the ten runs on Sunday in Chicago is the exception to the rule, and that the listless offense we\xe2\x80\x99ve seen this week in Oakland is actually the norm. This is not a poor-hitting team; they\xe2\x80\x99re a team that\xe2\x80\x99s scuffling just a bit at the plate right now.And the sad thing is that the Birds squared a lot of balls up last night \xe2\x80\x93 heck, for this entire series. But the Oakland Coliseum is so big, that those balls seemed to find a fielder\xe2\x80\x99s glove.\xc2\xa0Manny Machado addressed this after the game (quote courtesy of Roch Kubatko, MASNsports):Every game counts, so it\xe2\x80\x99s difficult going out there and we can\xe2\x80\x99t find a break. We\xe2\x80\x99re squaring balls up and we can\xe2\x80\x99t really do anything about it. We\xe2\x80\x99re having good at-bats. We\xe2\x80\x99re doing what we need to do, trying to get guys over, and it\xe2\x80\x99s just not falling for us. So we just have to stay positive, stay together and keep playing as a team and keep doing it. Eventually things will turn around.So the question is\xc2\xa0what can the O\xe2\x80\x99s do to fix this? As Machado said, they\xe2\x80\x99re having good at-bats, and the ball just isn\xe2\x80\x99t falling. I mean\xe2\x80\xa6could it really be as simple as saying\xc2\xa0just hit \xe2\x80\x99em where they ain\xe2\x80\x99t?\xc2\xa0More from Editorials/Analysis2/20 - Baltimore Orioles: Previewing the 2017 Season2/18 - Baltimore Orioles: How safe is Joey Rickard\xe2\x80\x99s spot on the roster?2/15 - Baltimore Orioles: Time to snap up Jorge De La Rosa?2/13 - Baltimore Orioles: Nevada Sportsbooks Betting on a 2017 Decline1/30 - Baltimore Orioles: Craig Breslow is an intriguing name for the Orioles to considerAdmittedly I\xe2\x80\x99m not a fan of \xe2\x80\x9csimplicity.\xe2\x80\x9d In my world there always has to be some sort of complex fix to a problem. I suppose in a way a complex solution justifies a complex problem. So I\xe2\x80\x99m not a big fan of saying\xc2\xa0hit \xe2\x80\x99em where they ain\xe2\x80\x98t, but I can\xe2\x80\x99t really think of anything else to suggest!The O\xe2\x80\x99s do need to get this fixed, however. It\xe2\x80\x99s easy enough to also say that Oakland has never been good to the O\xe2\x80\x99s, however as Machado said these games still count. As I said above, the Ravens kick off their preseason slate tonight. To me NFL preseason is a time marker \xe2\x80\x93 we\xe2\x80\x99re starting the turn for home. The Orioles are as much in this as anyone else \xe2\x80\x93 they just need to get their bats back on track.\xc2\xa0Next: Baltiore Orioles: Rebirth of Dylan BundyThe Birds will attempt to salvage a win in this afternoon\xe2\x80\x99s series finale in Oakland.\xc2\xa0Chris Tillman will be on the hill, and he\xe2\x80\x99ll be opposed by Oakland\xe2\x80\x99s\xc2\xa0Andrew Triggs. Game time is set for just after 3:30 PM. ", 'birdswatcher.com')]

[('With September call-ups approaching, the Orioles have ...', ' The Orioles are in the middle of a playoff push, and September is fast approaching. That means it\xe2\x80\x99s almost time for the O\xe2\x80\x99s (and every other team) to take advantage of one of the more controversial rules in baseball: September roster expansion. On the first of the month, the 25-player limit goes out the window, and teams are free to use up to their entire 40-man roster. Honestly, this seems a little ridiculous, and Buck Showalter agrees. He\xe2\x80\x99s previously advocated for a more reasonable expansion (something like 30 or 32 players), but that hasn\xe2\x80\x99t happened yet, and he\xe2\x80\x99s not going to put the Orioles at a competitive disadvantage just to make a point. Still, you won\xe2\x80\x99t be seeing 40 players in the Orioles\xe2\x80\x99 dugout three weeks from now. Buck doesn\xe2\x80\x99t like an overcrowded clubhouse and isn\xe2\x80\x99t going to carry guys just to carry them. It\xe2\x80\x99s more likely that we\xe2\x80\x99ll see the roster expand to something in the 33-35 player range.  That\xe2\x80\x99s what the team has done in recent seasons, although the situation is a little different this year. The Norfolk Tides\xe2\x80\x99 season will wrap up on September 5th, and at 50-68 it\xe2\x80\x99s safe to say they won\xe2\x80\x99t make the playoffs. Last season, they weren\xe2\x80\x99t eliminated from the postseason until mid-September.     If anything, that could mean we\xe2\x80\x99ll see more players added to the big club. Whereas the 2015 Orioles might have preferred to have a younger pitcher get consistent innings for Norfolk rather than be the 12th man in the bullpen, that won\xe2\x80\x99t be a dilemma this time around. If they think they can use a player, they\xe2\x80\x99ll take him.    So, who might the call-ups be? First of all, we know that the team will call up at least a few pitchers to serve as bullpen help. Odrisamer Despaigne seems like an obvious choice, as do Mike Wright and Tyler Wilson. All three are likely to be in Baltimore in a few weeks. Beyond them, there are nine other pitchers currently on the 40-man roster. Brian Duensing is hurt, so he\xe2\x80\x99s out. Chris Lee and Parker Bridwell have never thrown a major league pitch, and that probably won\xe2\x80\x99t change next month.    T.J. McFarland is pitching a rehab assignment in Frederick on Monday, and if everything goes well he\xe2\x80\x99ll probably be back when the rosters expand. Jason Garcia is unlikely to be called up this year, and I\xe2\x80\x99m not sure Oliver Drake fits - he\xe2\x80\x99d be the tenth righty in the bullpen if Despaigne/Wilson/Wright all get the nod. Finally, there\xe2\x80\x99s a trio of three lefty specialists - Jayson Aquino, Logan Ondrusek (who\xe2\x80\x99s right-handed, but was acquired because of his reverse splits), and Ashur Tolliver. It\xe2\x80\x99s a good bet that the O\xe2\x80\x99s will take at least one, considering Zach Britton and Donnie Hart are the only lefties in the bullpen (McFarland would be the second). If Hart remains on the 25-man roster, Ondrusek seems like the most likely to join him. Moving on to position players, the easiest one to call is Joey Rickard, who will certainly be placed on the active roster if he\xe2\x80\x99s able to come back in time from his thumb injury. The only other outfielder on the 40-man who isn\xe2\x80\x99t currently in Baltimore is Dariel Alvarez - there\xe2\x80\x99s a chance we\xe2\x80\x99ll be seeing him again too.     Alvarez would be easier to call up, but for this team Julio Borbon seems like a better choice. The O\xe2\x80\x99s have corner outfielders in spades, especially when Rickard returns. Two things they don\xe2\x80\x99t have are guys who can run and guys who can play center field. I have a feeling we\xe2\x80\x99ll see a move to get Borbon in the fold for the stretch run. For infielders, it gets a bit trickier. Right now, the only infielder currently on the 40-man roster is Christian Walker. He may be added to the roster to serve as another right-handed bench bat (especially if Alvarez doesn\xe2\x80\x99t make the trip North) but he\xe2\x80\x99s not really what the O\xe2\x80\x99s need. What the O\xe2\x80\x99s need is someone like Paul Janish. He\xe2\x80\x99s the exact type of player who always gets called up to the big leagues in September - a one-dimensional defense-first player that can play every infield position. Finally, almost every team adds a third catcher this time of year. Francisco Pena is on the roster already. This one\xe2\x80\x99s easy. All in all, my guess is that we\xe2\x80\x99ll see a few more players than usual added to the Orioles clubhouse in a few weeks. Despaigne, Wilson, Wright, Pena and Rickard (if healthy) seem like near-locks. Throw in two of McFarland/Ondrusek/Aquino/Tolliver, which would bolster the bullpen\xe2\x80\x99s ability to match up with left-handed hitters.     Finally, Borbon and Janish fill specific needs and I\xe2\x80\x99d be surprised if Dan Duquette doesn\xe2\x80\x99t bring the ax down on couple low-ceiling players (Tolliver? Drake?) to make room for them. Add one of Walker/Alvarez and that gets the Orioles to an even 35 players. Clearly, the O\xe2\x80\x99s don\xe2\x80\x99t have an exciting top prospect ready to break into the bigs for the stretch run. None of the guys I just mentioned are less than 25, and none are really prospects at all.  But while the Orioles don\xe2\x80\x99t have a Dylan Bundy to bring up this time around, what they do have is are a ton of bullpen arms and a small group of veteran players who fit of the team\xe2\x80\x99s specific needs. The players might not be flashy, but at least the O\xe2\x80\x99s have plenty of options.    ', 'www.camdenchat.com'), ('Orioles in Power Rankings - Week 18 - Camden Chat', " We know computers hate the Orioles, and national broadcasters hate the Orioles, but do the folks who make power polls/rankings hate the Orioles? Thankfully, most of these polls took place before the debacle in Oakland.     SI.com: The 30 (4th; Last Week: 6th) Jonah Keri lifted the Orioles up two slots, with only the Blue Jays moving ahead of our Birds among American League teams.  USA Today Power Rankings (4th; LW: 7th) The Nation\xe2\x80\x99s Newspaper makes the O\xe2\x80\x99s the biggest gainer of the week, cracking the Top Five with ease. \xe2\x80\x9cShould Zach Britton be part of Cy Young conversation?\xe2\x80\x9d Great question!  Bleacher Report Power Rankings (8th; LW: 14th) Slideshow Central returns to traditional ranking of teams this week after last week\xe2\x80\x99s draft pick version. And they still screw it up, placing the O\xe2\x80\x99s behind the Tigers. The Tigers. Really? \xe2\x80\x9cSeries wins against the Texas Rangers and Chicago White Sox move the Baltimore Orioles back inside the top 10 after their quiet trade deadline cost them a handful of spots a week ago. Credit the Orioles' ability to beat fellow AL East foes as a big reason why they currently sit atop the division standings, as their 26-19 in-division record is among the best in the AL.\xe2\x80\x9d    MLB.com (4th; LW: 7th) MLB.com uses analysts for 75% of their polls\xe2\x80\x99 composition, and fan votes for the other 25%. The experts have the O\xe2\x80\x99s at #4, the fans at #6, so the O\xe2\x80\x99s end up at #4, I\xe2\x80\x99ll take it.    CBS Sports (5th; LW: 4th)  Matt Synder drops the O\xe2\x80\x99s just one slot. \xe2\x80\x9cManny Machado homered in each of the first three innings on Sunday, making him the second man ever to do that. I don't know if I've mentioned before that he's fun to watch. I haven't, right? I'm pretty sure it's a no. Hmm \xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d Power Rankings Guru (6th; LW 7th)  PRG is an aggregate of several national power rankings/polls, and they have the O\xe2\x80\x99s up one slot to 6th.    reddit\xe2\x80\x99s Power Poll (6th; LW: 6th) The community editors over at reddit have the Orioles just out of the top five, but at least they\xe2\x80\x99re ahead of the Red Sox, finally. \xe2\x80\x9cIt's August and the O's are in 1st place in the AL East and have the 4th best winning percentage in the majors. Pedro Alvarez and J.J. Hardy have been the team's best players on offense for the past month by far. Dylan Bundy looks like the best starter on the team and might be a legitimate ace. Just as everyone predicted. But seriously, Bundy has looked good.\xe2\x80\x9d OddsShark.com (16th; LW: 24th) Ranks are based on rolling past 20 games overall. And they still have the Orioles in the bottom half of the league. This is why I don\xe2\x80\x99t place bets with actual American currency.  The Baltimore Sun's MLB Power Rankings (5th; LW: 2nd)     The Sun\xe2\x80\x99s Jon Meoli has the O\xe2\x80\x99s in the top five. \xe2\x80\x9cSpeaking of inconsistent offenses being bailed out by pitching, the Orioles remain in first place and are treading water on their last terrible road trip of the year. Part of that reason is a rotation that has a 3.92 ERA since the All-Star break. Everyone involved will take that, right?\xe2\x80\x9d ESPN.com Power Poll (6th; LW: 9th) The World-Wide Leader may be finally starting to believe in the Birds. \xe2\x80\x9cAfter taking two of three from the White Sox in Chicago, the Orioles are clinging to a one-game division lead. They now head west for seven games against the A's and Giants, hoping to return home still in first.\xe2\x80\x9d -- Matt Kremnitzer (@mattkremnitzer), Camden Depot Any egregious slights or wild overestimation of this team? Any polls you\xe2\x80\x99d like to see included? Add your thought down below and hit me up on Twitter @Bill_Duck21804 where you will find way, way too much discussion of politics and MMA for any baseball fan\xe2\x80\x99s liking.    ", 'www.camdenchat.com')]

[('Orioles back in first in AL East with win over Giants', 'San Francisco Giants starting pitcher Matt Cain throws in the first inning of a baseball game against the Baltimore Orioles, Friday, Aug. 12, 2016, in San Francisco. (AP Photo/Eric Risberg)(Photo: The Associated Press)CONNECTTWEETLINKEDINCOMMENTEMAILMORESAN FRANCISCO (AP) \xe2\x80\x94 After three straight wins, including consecutive starts in which he threw five scoreless innings, Matt Cain lost his command Friday night and the San Francisco Giants lost in their return home from a nine-game road trip.Cain (4-7) allowed five runs and 11 hits in four-plus innings, including home runs by Mark Trumbo and Chris Davis, and the Giants lost 5-2 to the Baltimore Orioles in a game between teams fighting for division leads."I just got pitches back on the plate a little bit more today," Cain said. "I got the heaters on the plate and they didn\'t miss them."Giants manager Bruce Bochy said Cain "didn\'t have his good fastball command.""A lot of them came back over the plate," Bochy said. "They\'re a good hitting ball club with a lot of power. They took advantage of him. He just didn\'t have his good command. So that was pretty much the story. He got a lot of balls up."In just his sixth career start, Dylan Bundy relied on mental strength more than physical dominance to pitch the Orioles back into first place in the AL East.Bundy allowed one run and three hits in 5 2-3 innings, Trumbo regained the major league lead with his 33rd home run and Zach Britton notched his 36th save.Orioles manager Buck Showalter said Bundy (6-3) didn\'t have a good feel for his curveball and "it was good seeing him compete and fight through it."Bundy acknowledged he didn\'t have command of his pitches at points and refused to blame it on a cool night in San Francisco, with the temperature in the 50s."Weather is the easy excuse, but it was just that you can\'t have your best stuff every time," Bundy said. "You just got to focus a little more, get the ball over the plate and let them get themselves out."Trumbo\'s two-run homer in the third inning traveled an estimated 441 feet, landing near the back of the stands in left field. Earlier Friday, Toronto\'s Edwin Encarnacion hit his 32nd home run to tie Trumbo for the MLB lead.Trumbo said he hadn\'t known that Encarnacion had homered, and said it was way too early to worry about who\'s leading the majors in homers."The win matters, I don\'t care about the other stuff," he said.The Orioles\' win, coupled with the Blue Jays\' 5-3 home loss to Houston, moved Baltimore back into first place by a half-game over Toronto. The Giants retained their one-game lead in the NL West over the Los Angeles Dodgers, who lost 5-1 at home to Pittsburgh.Davis led off the fifth with his 24th homer of the season for the Orioles, who are 4-4 on a 10-game road trip that ends Sunday in San Francisco. Matt Wieters and Adam Jones had RBIs in the Orioles\' two-run second.Denard Span drove in San Francisco\'s first run with a third-inning double. Brandon Belt added an RBI single in the ninth.Britton, who leads the AL in saves, has not blown a save this season, and hasn\'t allowed an earned run in his last 40 games.The Giants have lost eight of their last 10 interleague games.TRAINER\'S ROOMOrioles: Showalter said RHP Darren O\'Day was sent home to Baltimore for tests after experiencing shoulder discomfort in Thursday\'s relief appearance at Oakland. ... Showalter said INF Steve Pearce, who has missed four games with an injured flexor tendon in his right arm, should be ready to return Saturday.Giants: Bochy said there\'s no date set for the return of RHP Cory Gearrin, who has made five relief appearances at Triple-A Sacramento while rehabbing from a right shoulder strain.BRONZED PERRYThe Giants will dedicate a nine-foot bronze statue to Hall of Fame pitcher Gaylord Perry on Saturday before their game against the Orioles. Fellow Giants Hall of Famers Willie Mays, Willie McCovey, Juan Marichal and Orlando Cepeda, all of whom already have statues outside AT&T Park, are expected to attend. Perry, 77, talking before Friday\'s game, as usual refused to say whether he ever doctored the ball during his 22-year MLB career.GIANTS HOMECOMINGThe Giants opened a 10-game homestand after finishing a 4-5 road trip to Philadelphia, Washington and Miami. Bochy said he was looking forward to having 15 of the team\'s next 18 games in San Francisco. "It\'s important to have a good homestand and get back to who we are," he said. "We\'ve been sputtering since the All-Star break."UP NEXTOrioles: Kevin Gausman (3-9, 4.02 ERA) starts Saturday against the Giants. He is tied for the team lead with quality starts in 60 percent of his 20 outings this season.Giants: Madison Bumgarner (10-7, 2.20) makes his 25th start of 2016 on Saturday. The Giants have lost his last five starts, including a 1-0 complete game defeat at Washington last Sunday.CONNECTTWEETLINKEDINCOMMENTEMAILMORECopyright 2016 The Associated Press. All rights reserved. This material may not be published, broadcast, rewritten or redistributed. ', 'www.usatoday.com'), ('Baltimore Orioles: Other side of the Bay Area is kinder', "The Baltimore Orioles crossed the bay area and headed to San Francisco last night, where they found things to be a bit kinder than in Oakland.Perhaps all it took to right the Baltimore Orioles was to cross San Francisco Bay. Out in the Bay Area \xc2\xa0for a week, the Birds found the going tough the first three games in Oakland. However they won Thursday\xe2\x80\x99s series finale, and then proceeded to cross San Francisco Bay over to play the Giants.And in doing so, they got another decent start out of Dylan Bundy \xe2\x80\x93 who\xe2\x80\x99s been \xe2\x80\x9ckilling it\xe2\x80\x9d as a starter in the second half. Bundy\xe2\x80\x99s line: 5.2 IP, 3 H, 1 R, 2 BB, 3 K. According to the numbers this wasn\xe2\x80\x99t a quality start because Bundy didn\xe2\x80\x99t go the required six innings. But it\xe2\x80\x99s a quality start.The O\xe2\x80\x99s got an RBI-double from Matt Wieters, and an RBI-single from Adam Jones in the second inning to take a 2-0 lead. One inning later\xc2\xa0Mark Trubo continued his hot streak and smacked his league-leading 33rd home run \xe2\x80\x93 a two-run shot. After three innings (or two-and-a-half) the O\xe2\x80\x99s held a 4-0 lead, which gave them some breathing room.\xc2\xa0Live Feed baltimore oriolesBaltimore Orioles: Chris Tillman's return was a welcomed one in Baltimore The Baltimore WireBaltimore Orioles: Injury update on Orioles starting pitcher Wade Miley The Baltimore WireCurt Schilling Continues to be an Embarrassment Call to the PenBaltimore Orioles: Chris Tillman season debut scheduled for Sunday Call to the PenFantasy Baseball 2017: Zach Britton back on 10-day DL Fantasy Baseball CrackerjacksBaltimore Orioles Acquire Jordan Kipper from Angels The Baltimore WireSan Francisco battled back ever so slightly in the last of the third when Span\xe2\x80\x99s RBI-double got them on the board. However in the fifth\xc2\xa0Chris Davis would launch a solo homer, before San Francisco added on a token RBI-single in the ninth. The O\xe2\x80\x99s wound up with a 5-2 victory\xe2\x80\xa6on the dock of the \xe2\x80\x98Frisco Bay.It\xe2\x80\x99s almost uncanny how a team as good as the Orioles can struggle so mightily against bad teams (such as Oakland). However when you put them against a team like San Francisco (who\xe2\x80\x99s in a pennant race of their own), they step it up. And playing up or down to your competition is something that\xe2\x80\x99s rampant across sports, so it\xe2\x80\x99s not just the O\xe2\x80\x99s. I\xe2\x80\x99m just not sure why it happens!\xc2\xa0More from Editorials/Analysis2/20 - Baltimore Orioles: Previewing the 2017 Season2/18 - Baltimore Orioles: How safe is Joey Rickard\xe2\x80\x99s spot on the roster?2/15 - Baltimore Orioles: Time to snap up Jorge De La Rosa?2/13 - Baltimore Orioles: Nevada Sportsbooks Betting on a 2017 Decline1/30 - Baltimore Orioles: Craig Breslow is an intriguing name for the Orioles to considerOne theory might be that baseball is one of the only sports where\xc2\xa0playing until the bitter end is a thing. Maybe not until the bitter end per se, but at least through August. If you\xe2\x80\x99re on a bad team, you might still have some incentive to play hard given that trades through waivers happen all the time during this month. So if you play hard maybe you\xe2\x80\x99ll get dealt to a contender.My theory of course is that you should always play hard, but that\xe2\x80\x99s beside the point However the O\xe2\x80\x99s found the San Francisco side of the Bay Area to be kinder than the Oakland side \xe2\x80\x93 at least at first. The O\xe2\x80\x99s beat a good team in San Francisco last night, and for their sake they have to hope it continues for the remainder of the series.\xc2\xa0Next: Baltimore Orioles hold on for Chris Tillman's 15th winAnd as the series continues tonight they\xe2\x80\x99ll have their work cut out for them based on who the opposing pitcher is slated to be.\xc2\xa0Kevin Gausman\xc2\xa0will be on the mound for the Orioles, and he\xe2\x80\x99ll be opposed by San Francisco\xe2\x80\x99s\xc2\xa0Madison Bumgarner.\xc2\xa0Game time is set for just after 9 PM. ", 'birdswatcher.com')]

[('Baltimore Orioles: MLB must address it\\u2019s instant replay system', "The Baltimore Orioles were victim of a situation where instant replay failed in last night\xe2\x80\x99s 6-2 loss in SF. MLB needs to address it\xe2\x80\x99s system \xe2\x80\x93 and soon.For starters, the Baltimore Orioles didn\xe2\x80\x99t lose 6-2 last night in San Francisco because of an instant replay snafu. They lost because they could only put two runs on the board, didn\xe2\x80\x99t take advantage of opportunities, and because San Francisco took advantage of theirs. The fact that\xc2\xa0Kevin Gausman walked six hitters didn\xe2\x80\x99t help either; Gausman\xe2\x80\x99s line: 4.0 IP, 2 H, 2 R, 6 BB, 9 K.Having said that, one of the big opportunities of which San Francisco took advantage came on the heels of a confusing and frustrating moment in the sixth inning in which the Orioles found themselves gerrymandered out of an out. One play a game does not make \xe2\x80\x93 and that goes without saying. However when cracks appear in a system that\xe2\x80\x99s designed to get the call right, it presents a huge problem. And someone out there has to be taxed with fixing it\xe2\x80\xa6looking at you, Mr. Commissioner.San Francisco took a 2-0 in the second on Span\xe2\x80\x99s two-RBI double. He would add a two-RBI single in the last of the sixth, which followed the Orioles\xe2\x80\x99 protestation of the instant replay call in the top of the inning. One inning later San Francisco blew the game wide open as Belt smacked a two-run homer to run the score to 6-0. The Birds would manage to get on the board in the ninth on a two-RBI single by\xc2\xa0Ryan Flaherty, however it was too little too late.\xc2\xa0Live Feed baltimore oriolesBaltimore Orioles: Chris Tillman's return was a welcomed one in Baltimore The Baltimore WireBaltimore Orioles: Injury update on Orioles starting pitcher Wade Miley The Baltimore WireCurt Schilling Continues to be an Embarrassment Call to the PenBaltimore Orioles: Chris Tillman season debut scheduled for Sunday Call to the PenFantasy Baseball 2017: Zach Britton back on 10-day DL Fantasy Baseball CrackerjacksBaltimore Orioles Acquire Jordan Kipper from Angels The Baltimore WireGoing back to the top of the sixth,\xc2\xa0Adam Jones\xc2\xa0appeared to offer at a pitch in the form of a bunt to lead off the inning. The ball appeared to catch part of Jones\xe2\x80\x99 hand as well, and it landed in fair terrority \xe2\x80\x93 he was quickly thrown out, but he doubled over in pain. (He would stay in the game, and he says he\xe2\x80\x99ll be ready for today\xe2\x80\x99s game as well.) Interestingly, Jones remained on the field during the medical look-over, which was strange given that he had grounded out\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\xa6but Jones knew he hadn\xe2\x80\x99t grounded out. The ball had hit his finger, and then it actually touched his knee before landing fair. Home plate umpire Brian O\xe2\x80\x99Nora ruled that Jones had offered at the pitch, which is why the call on the field was a fair ball. Manager\xc2\xa0Buck Showalter induced a bit of a delay trying to argue his case for a replay review. After awhile the umpires got on the headset to New York, only to apparently be told that the play wasn\xe2\x80\x99t reviewable.I\xe2\x80\x99m not suggesting that the umpires are out to get the Orioles or anything like that (although some Oriole players did have an interesting opinion on O\xe2\x80\x99Nora\xe2\x80\x99s strike zone.) I do firmly believe that umpires want to get these calls right, and that they\xe2\x80\x99re doing everything they can to do so. However if the system that\xe2\x80\x99s designed to help them get it right is actually preventing them from doing so, that\xe2\x80\x99s a huge problem.Hit-by-a-pitch is actually reviewable \xe2\x80\x93 however it would have been inconclusive as to whether or not the ball hit Jones before hitting the bat and so forth. (However obviously Jones\xe2\x80\x99 reaction told us that the ball hit him.) What they wanted to review was whether or not the ball hit Jones\xe2\x80\x99 knee before landing fair. If it did, they it\xe2\x80\x99s a foul ball. And the replay was pretty conclusive that it hit Jones\xe2\x80\x99 knee.\xc2\xa0More from Editorials/Analysis2/20 - Baltimore Orioles: Previewing the 2017 Season2/18 - Baltimore Orioles: How safe is Joey Rickard\xe2\x80\x99s spot on the roster?2/15 - Baltimore Orioles: Time to snap up Jorge De La Rosa?2/13 - Baltimore Orioles: Nevada Sportsbooks Betting on a 2017 Decline1/30 - Baltimore Orioles: Craig Breslow is an intriguing name for the Orioles to considerSo my question is\xc2\xa0why is this not reviewable? I mean, is there a legitiate reason why plays in front of the base umpires can\xe2\x80\x99t be reviewed? I suspect that there is, and that reason in fact might even be fairly legitimate. However to piggyback on what I said above, a system that\xe2\x80\x99s designed to get calls right shouldn\xe2\x80\x99t in turn prevent those calls from being made. That makes no sense\xe2\x80\xa6again, looking at you, Mr. Commissioner.Buck Showalter was given the standard answer about the call not being reviewable at the time (quote courtesy of Roch Kubatko, MASNsports):First, it was a challenge. They had to go there. The ball hits his finger and he doesn\xe2\x80\x99t make an attempt at it, it\xe2\x80\x99s a dead ball, OK? They say it\xe2\x80\x99s non-reviewable once he made an attempt at it, so there was no challenge and we were told it was non-reviewable.If that play is reviewed and presumably overturned, Jones continues his at-bat. It\xe2\x80\x99s not fair to assume that all things would have been the same in that inning given that scenario. However the Birds ended up with two runners in scoring position and one out in that inning. If Jones gets on, perhaps the Orioles score at least one run. That could have changed the entire scope of the game.Or it could have not changed anything. With the way that Bumgarner was painting the corners and the way that Oriole pitchers were nibbling on those same corners and having their pitches called balls, there\xe2\x80\x99s a chance nothing would have changed. All of that is a very tough sell.However what\xe2\x80\x99s not a tough sell is that something needs to change in the instant replay system. In some cases we\xe2\x80\x99re starting to see calls overturned leaguewide without clear evidence, as well as calls left to stand that had clear evidence. And in cases like this, the system itself doesn\xe2\x80\x99t allow for the correct call to be made. How doe it play if a team finds itself out of the race by one game and they had a situation like this at some point along the way? Something needs to change, Mr. Commissioner.\xc2\xa0Next: Baltimore Orioles: This side of the Bay Area is kinderThe series will conclude this afternoon in San Francisco.\xc2\xa0Wade Miley will get the start for the Orioles, and he\xe2\x80\x99ll be opposed by SF\xe2\x80\x99s\xc2\xa0Johnny Cueto. Game time is set for just after 4 PM. ", 'birdswatcher.com'), ('Giants blow 6-run lead in 8-7 loss to Orioles; remain in 1st', 'San Francisco Giants relief pitcher Santiago Casilla reacts after yielding a three-run home run to Baltimore Orioles\' Jonathan Schoop during the ninth inning of a baseball game, Sunday, Aug. 14, 2016, in San Francisco. The Orioles won 8-7. (AP Photo/D. Ross Cameron)(Photo: The Associated Press)CONNECTTWEETLINKEDINCOMMENTEMAILMORESAN FRANCISCO (AP) \xe2\x80\x94 The San Francisco Giants\' second-half slide continued with arguably their most dispiriting loss yet.Jonathan Schoop hit a three-run homer in the ninth inning Sunday and the Baltimore Orioles overcame a six-run deficit to give the struggling Giants another deflating loss, 8-7."The bullpen, which has really done a terrific job, had just a little hiccup today," Giants manager Bruce Bochy said. "Those losses are always tough. You have a lead like that and you can\'t hold on to it."Schoop smacked a 1-0 curveball off closer Santiago Casilla (2-4) into the left-field bleachers after Manny Machado singled and Mark Trumbo walked."I have confidence in all of my pitches," Casilla said through a translator. "I threw the curveball, I just made a mistake. The ball didn\'t break."Schoop leads the Orioles with 12 game-winning RBI."Good things seem to follow him around," Orioles manager Buck Showalter said. "He\'s getting out of the game what he puts into it. Jon doesn\'t cheat the game. It\'s good to see people who approach the game that way get a return for it."Baltimore trailed 7-1 after six but got two runs in each of the seventh and eighth innings."They\'re a good club," Bochy said of the Orioles. "They have a dangerous lineup one through eight there, they can hurt you, that\'s what happened today."The Giants led the NL West by 6 1/2 games at the All-Star break but have gone 9-18 since. They remained one game ahead of the Dodgers, who lost to Pittsburgh 11-3.Giants starter Johnny Cueto extended his streak of winless starts to six. He allowed one run on eight hits and one walk in 6 2/3 innings. He also had two hits and one RBI.Trevor Brown had two hits and three RBIs, Angel Pagan doubled twice and Hunter Pence homered for the first time since coming off a two-month stint on the disabled list for the Giants.Pagan extended his hitting streak to 12 games.Brown had a two-run single that highlighted a four-run fifth inning. He was added to the lineup when catcher Buster Posey was a late scratch with lower back tightness."Brown got some big hits," Bochy said. "He was a late starter. ... It was about 40 minutes before the game that we scratched Buster."Posey entered the game in the ninth inning as a pinch-hitter."I don\'t know if it was something on the flight back," Posey said. "I didn\'t feel it necessarily on the plane. It\'s gradually felt more and more over the last few days."Matt Wieters had a career-best five hits, including a triple, and the Orioles won for the third time in four games and concluded a 10-game trip with an even record. Baltimore trails Toronto by half a game in the AL East.Brad Brach (7-1) pitched a scoreless eighth inning for Baltimore.Orioles closer Zach Britton pitched a scoreless ninth inning for his 37th save in 37 chances, extending the longest streak for a left-hander in major league history.The Giants had runners at first and second with two outs when Britton got Denard Span to ground into a force out at second.Derek Law allowed one hit in a scoreless 2/3 of an inning in the eighth that extended his consecutive streak of scoreless outings to 19.Trumbo hit his major league-leading 34th homer off Hunter Strickland in the top of the eighth inning to move ahead of Edwin Encarnacion, who hit his 33rd earlier in the day for Toronto.BATGIRL HONOREDThe Giants unveiled a plaque in their dugout before the game commemorating Alexis Busch, the first full-time bat girl in major league history, who was killed in a sailing crash in 2012 at age 26. She was the daughter of former Giants executive vice president Corey Busch and served as the team\'s batgirl from 2000 to 2001.TRAINER\'S ROOMGiants: OF Mac Williamson, on the disabled list since Aug. 1 with a left shoulder strain, began a rehab assignment with Triple-A Sacramento. ... RHP Cory Gearrin, out since July 6 with a right shoulder strain, pitched for a second straight day on Saturday for Triple-A Sacramento. He\'ll continue his rehab assignment as the Giants consider the timing of his return.UP NEXTGiants: Newly acquired LHP Matt Moore will make his home debut in a series opener with Pittsburgh. He is 0-1 with a 3.00 ERA in his first two starts with San Francisco and 7-8 with a 3.99 ERA in 23 combined starts with the Giants and Tampa Bay.CONNECTTWEETLINKEDINCOMMENTEMAILMORECopyright 2016 The Associated Press. All rights reserved. This material may not be published, broadcast, rewritten or redistributed. ', 'www.usatoday.com')]

[('Baltimore Orioles: Fighting Showalters delivered from evil', "After trailing 7-1 entering the 7th inning, Jonathan Schoop\xe2\x80\x99s three-run homer in the ninth propelled the Baltimore Orioles to an 8-7 win in San Francisco.It\xe2\x80\x99s easy for anyone to say\xc2\xa0you always play until the end when the score is 7-1 going into the 7th inning \xe2\x80\x93 but the Baltimore Orioles, or Fighting Showalters that is,\xc2\xa0lived that yesterday. For much of the game there wasn\xe2\x80\x99t much that broke the Orioles\xe2\x80\x99 way, be it moves made from the dugout or bounces on the field. But for one fleeting moment, everything broke for the O\xe2\x80\x99s the way that it needed to in order for them to win. And luckily for them, that moment happened at the end of the game.Wade Miley was a victim of what I described above; nothing breaking his way, that is. Miley\xe2\x80\x99s line: 4.1 IP, 8 H, 7 R (6 earned), 2 BB, 1 K. If it wasn\xe2\x80\x99t a Brown RBI-single for the first run (on the heels of a\xc2\xa0Mark Trumbo error), it was Pence hitting only his eighth homer of the season. Heck, even the starting pitcher Cueto got into the act, with an RBI-single in the last of the fourth to give San Francisco a 3-0 lead. The Orioles\xe2\x80\x99 lone run in the first part of the game was an RBI-single by\xc2\xa0Adam Jones.This is not to say that Miley was crisp yesterday. He had some poor luck for sure, but he was also in the middle of the plate for his entire outing. But that\xe2\x80\x99s not the main story of yesterday\xe2\x80\x99s game. The main story begins when most folks figured that the game was over. And it really typifies the whole concept of \xe2\x80\x9cthe Fighting Showalters,\xe2\x80\x9d which began in 2011.\xc2\xa0Live Feed baltimore oriolesBaltimore Orioles: Chris Tillman's return was a welcomed one in Baltimore The Baltimore WireBaltimore Orioles: Injury update on Orioles starting pitcher Wade Miley The Baltimore WireCurt Schilling Continues to be an Embarrassment Call to the PenBaltimore Orioles: Chris Tillman season debut scheduled for Sunday Call to the PenFantasy Baseball 2017: Zach Britton back on 10-day DL Fantasy Baseball CrackerjacksBaltimore Orioles Acquire Jordan Kipper from Angels The Baltimore WireIt began innocently enough \xe2\x80\x93 Jones netted the Birds\xe2\x80\x99 second run with a sac fly-RBI in the seventh. That cut the San Francisco lead to 7-2. However Kim added an RBI-double, and one inning later Trumbo \xc2\xa0smacked his 34th homer of the season to cut the lead to 7-4. If you\xe2\x80\x99re San Francisco, alarm bells have to be starting to go off in your head at this point. But nobody was going to come back from six down after the seventh inning\xe2\x80\xa6were they?Again, that\xe2\x80\x99s why these Fighting Showalters play every game until it\xe2\x80\x99s final out. Later in that eighth inning Hardy\xe2\x80\x99s RBI-single cut the lead to 7-5. The O\xe2\x80\x99s then had a runner at second base with two outs in the the ninth, with Trumbo coming to the plate again. However San Francisco wanted no part of Trumbo potentially tying the game at that late hour. So they pitched around him\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\xa6to get to\xc2\xa0Jonathan Schoop. From San Francisco\xe2\x80\x99s perspective it was probably very simple; Schoop records the final out, and that\xe2\x80\x99s the end of it. The hometown fans go home happy, and the O\xe2\x80\x99s go home with questions about where their season is going. That\xe2\x80\x99s how they may have drawn it up \xe2\x80\x93 but sometimes the best-laid plans can be foiled.\xc2\xa0More from Editorials/Analysis2/20 - Baltimore Orioles: Previewing the 2017 Season2/18 - Baltimore Orioles: How safe is Joey Rickard\xe2\x80\x99s spot on the roster?2/15 - Baltimore Orioles: Time to snap up Jorge De La Rosa?2/13 - Baltimore Orioles: Nevada Sportsbooks Betting on a 2017 Decline1/30 - Baltimore Orioles: Craig Breslow is an intriguing name for the Orioles to considerSchoop jumped on a fastball on an 0-1 count. The left fielder never stood a chance, and San Francisco\xe2\x80\x99s gamble in walking Trumbo backfired. Schoop\xe2\x80\x99s three-run homer gave the O\xe2\x80\x99s an improbably 8-7 win, which turned into an 8-7 victory. The Birds thus took two-of-three in San Francisco.Make no mistake about the fact that this game is probably the biggest win of the season for the Orioles to this point. And that\xe2\x80\x99s no doubt due to the fact that it unfolded in the manner that it did. Coming back to win after being that far down that late in the game is always a special feat. And again make no mistake that it\xe2\x80\x99s also a feat that might make you point back to this game as a turning point when all\xe2\x80\x99s said and done.I\xe2\x80\x99m the first one to say that one game a season does not make. But that\xe2\x80\x99s not to say that you can\xe2\x80\x99t look back on specific games or moments as occurances that mattered. This could be one of those moments for this Baltimore Orioles team. Where they go from here remains to be seen, but this is about as uplifting a victory as you\xe2\x80\x99re going to see.\xc2\xa0Next: Baltimore Orioles: MLB must address instant replay systemOn a personal note, I feel that it\xe2\x80\x99s part of my job as a writer not to be overly emotional about these games. That\xe2\x80\x99s a stance best left to fans, who don\xe2\x80\x99t have to be as objective as I do. But the way that things unfolded in this game at the end took my breath away. It\xe2\x80\x99s an example of one of the things that makes baseball great as a sport. And it drives home the whole point of the Fighting Showalters moniker:\xc2\xa0ALWAYS PLAY EVERY GAME UNTIL THE FINAL OUT. ", 'birdswatcher.com'), ('A Recap of the Baltimore Orioles\\u2019 West Coast Trip', 'Aug 12, 2016; San Francisco, CA, USA; Baltimore Orioles starting pitcher Dylan Bundy (37) throws to the San Francisco Giants in the first inning of their MLB baseball game at AT&T Park. Mandatory Credit: Lance Iversen-USA TODAY SportsThe Baltimore Orioles just finished a road trip at 5-5. \xc2\xa0Not just any road trip, but a West Coast road trip in Oakland and San Francisco, with the Chicago White Sox at the start.For a team that is 27-34 on the road, to split a West Coast trip (their last of the year) is not bad. But, there are several items inside the games that help make the trip another successful one for the Orioles.First, they won two of the three series. Only a 1-3 series against the Oakland Athletics was a series loss for the O\xe2\x80\x99s. They beat the White Sox in two out of three and did the same to the NL West-leading San Francisco Giants.The pitching in the games was pretty good. The O\xe2\x80\x99s left up 5 (in a bizarre game where the bullpen blew up), 2, 2, 3, 2, 1, 6 (another game where the bullpen struggled), 2, 6, and 7 runs in those ten games.These were the numbers by the starters in those 10 games:1 \xe2\x80\x93 7-5 W over the White Sox: Gallardo (W) 6 IP, 7 H, 2 ER, 3 K2 \xe2\x80\x93 2-4 L vs. CWS: Tillman (L) 6 IP, 7 H, 3 ER, 4 K3 \xe2\x80\x93 10-2 W vs CWS: Bundy (W) 6 IP, 4 H, 2 ER, 9 K4 \xe2\x80\x93 2-3 L vs. Athletics: Gausman (L) 6 IP, 6 H, 2 ER, 6 K5 \xe2\x80\x93 1-2 L vs. A\xe2\x80\x99s: Miley (L) 6 IP, 6 H, 2 ER, 2 K6 \xe2\x80\x93 0-1 L vs. A\xe2\x80\x99s: Gallardo (L) 6 IP, 4 H, 1 ER, 6 K7 \xe2\x80\x93 9-6 W vs. A\xe2\x80\x99s: Tillman (W) 7 IP, 5 H, 2 ER, 4 K8 \xe2\x80\x93 5-2 W vs. Giants: Bundy (W) 5.2 IP, 3 H, 1 ER, 3 K9 \xe2\x80\x93 2-6 L vs. Giants: Gausman (L) 4 IP, 2 H, 2 ER, 9 K 6 BB10 \xe2\x80\x93 8-7 W vs. Giants: Miley 4.1 IP, 8 H, 6 ER, 1 KSo, what can we take from those starts? \xc2\xa0Well, the only one in which the starting pitcher did not get a decision was the comeback win on Sunday, where Wade Miley exited early and struggled.In addition, the first seven games of the trip were all quality starts. However, four of them were losses. \xc2\xa0So, the offensive struggles continue to keep the O\xe2\x80\x99s from the top of their potential.Dylan Bundy earned wins in both his starts, Kevin Gausman losses in both of his, although he only allowed two runs in each start.Gausman\xe2\x80\x99s start on Saturday was hampered by six walks, although comments by both he and Buck Showalter after the game indicated he was better than his line.For a team that continues to be all about the pitching, this trip was a success. \xc2\xa0The only pitcher who is really not keeping the O\xe2\x80\x99s in games at this point is Wade Miley. \xc2\xa0Hopefully he can settle in over the next few starts.The bullpen had a few hiccups, but not enough to blow any games. The Birds will have to rely on Mychal Givens more, and also Donnie Hart. \xc2\xa0Hart has been very good in his use as a lefty specialist. More from Baltimore Orioles5/8 - Baltimore Orioles: Matt Wieters Suits Up for His First Game Against Orioles5/8 - Baltimore Orioles Player Profile: Aderlin Rodriguez5/7 - Baltimore Orioles: Chris Tillman\xe2\x80\x99s return was a welcomed one in Baltimore5/7 - Baltimore Orioles: Injury update on Orioles starting pitcher Wade Miley5/6 - Baltimore Orioles Acquire Jordan Kipper from AngelsThe Orioles, as mentioned earlier by my colleague Randy Buchman, only lost half a game to the Blue Jays while on the trip. \xc2\xa0They now only have 20 road games left, while the Blue Jays have 25 and the Red Sox have 30!The team is still well-entrenched in a playoff spot, and now hopefully can make that even more so by beating up on the Red Sox and Eduardo Rodriguez on Tuesday in Baltimore.The Baltimore Orioles are a playoff team with just over a month and a half left in the season.And despite splitting 10 games, the team showed they just might have what it takes to contend in the postseason. ', 'thebaltimorewire.com'), ('The state of the Orioles bullpen with Darren O\\u2019Day back on ...', ' The good Orioles teams during the Buck Showalter/Dan Duquette era have been led by their bullpens. Showalter\xe2\x80\x99s adeptness at not only using his relievers in game, but keeping them fresh and able throughout the season has been a key to the Orioles winning more games than most people ever thought they ever would.     This is combined with Duquette\xe2\x80\x99s ability to constantly shuffle the roster to bring in fresh quality arms for Showalter to deploy.  One of the keys to the bullpen over the last five seasons has been Darren O\xe2\x80\x99Day and he just went down with a shoulder injury. This off the heels of a strained hamstring that kept him out for nearly two months. Not the ideal scenario the Orioles had when they surprisingly resigned O\xe2\x80\x99Day this off season for four years and $31 million.  The injuries are also on top of some poor performance with a 3.95 ERA. However, even while missing the all important O\xe2\x80\x99Day, the Orioles bullpen has still managed a 3.19 ERA, the best in the American league just beating out the Houston Astros.     With O\xe2\x80\x99Day out again the shuffling of the bullpen will begin. Tyler Wilson part time starter and part time reliever is back. When last with the Orioles he pitched four perfect innings and was then optioned to keep the bullpen flexible. It\xe2\x80\x99s a tough life being the 25th man on a Dan Duquette roster.     The bullpen as it stands now is Zach Britton, Brad Brach, Mychal Givens, Donnie Hart, Tyler Wilson, Vance Worley, and Ubaldo Jimenez. With Brian Matusz\xe2\x80\x99s early season departure the bullpen has lacked a true left handed specialist.  This has put pressure on either inexperienced players\xe2\x80\x94such as Hart or Ashur Tolliver\xe2\x80\x94or on Brad Brach to get out left handed hitters in late game situations. The wear and tear may be showing on Brach as he has a 3.60 ERA in the second half compared to a 0.91 ERA in the first half.     The results have been even worse in August as he has posted a 5.40 ERA to date. Showalter has responded by trying to pitch him less, only 10 innings so far in the second half and he still leads all Orioles\xe2\x80\x99 relievers in innings.  With no left handed pitcher, Brach\xe2\x80\x99s struggles of late, O\xe2\x80\x99Day\xe2\x80\x99s injury, and Givens\xe2\x80\x99 struggles against left handed hitters the Orioles are definitely in need of someone to get left handed hitters out.  Whether that is Donnie Hart or someone picked up during this August waiver period remains to be seen. I have faith that Givens can learn to get left handed batters out, but now is not the time for the Orioles to have that faith. They need a backup plan or a break out.     The Orioles as a pitching staff could use some help against left handed batters. Collectively, left handed hitters have a .344 wOBA against Orioles pitchers this year, that\xe2\x80\x99s the third highest in baseball. For reference, right handed hitters have a .303 wOBA against Orioles pitchers in 2016, which is right around the middle of the pack in baseball.  The right handed heavy rotation for the predominant part of the season has something to do with that. I wanted to see what the bullpen\xe2\x80\x99s numbers were specifically, but I could not readily find that split anywhere online.  Otherwise, the bullpen is definitely weighed down by Jimenez\xe2\x80\x99s presence. He has wobbled back and forth between effective and ineffective in his short and infrequent stints as a reliever in 2016.  Who would have thought that Jimenez would be inconsistent? Worley and Wilson provide decent options for when Showalter needs some innings eaten up, but both have their own warts. The move of Dylan Bundy to the rotation has hurt the bullpen some. He was a lights out reliever before he was a lights out starter.  However, with two option-able spots and a bevy of mediocre options available in the minors Showalter assuredly always has at least a fresh arm to go to, if not always a quality arm to go to.     The bullpen is far from the Orioles main concern (that would be the offense getting back on track and smashing balls into outer space again), but it is not without it\xe2\x80\x99s own issues.  Having the O\xe2\x80\x99Day of years past would make it truly formidable as Givens and Brach would be pushed back into the sixth and seventh innings and could be matched up on particular nights for particular lineups. But, with his injuries to date this year that O\xe2\x80\x99Day has not been around. The struggles against left handed hitters needs to be solved and the sooner the better.  Yet, the ultimate weapon in Zach Britton still exists. His sub 1 ERA, sky high ground ball rate, and perfect record so far in 2016 gives the Orioles the ultimate closer. With him at the back end, the bullpen has a high floor.  The Orioles will need the others to step up in O\xe2\x80\x99Days absence. With September right around the corner and roster expansion along with it, Showalter will have even more toys to play with. For our sake, let\xe2\x80\x99s hope it all works out.   ', 'www.camdenchat.com')]

[('Five things that must happen for Orioles to make playoffs', 'Chris Davis is hitting .160 with a .295 on-base percentage in 27 second-half games.(Photo: Kim Klement, USA TODAY Sports)CONNECTTWEET                              2                      LINKEDINCOMMENTEMAILMOREI guess, technically, the true stretch run in baseball occurs around Sept. 1.We\xe2\x80\x99re still in the dog days of August \xe2\x80\x93 something that has left renowned philosopher William Nathaniel Showalter wondering why it\xe2\x80\x99s not \xe2\x80\x9ccat days\xe2\x80\x9d of August.Anyway, it\xe2\x80\x99s crunch time at Camden Yards for the Baltimore Orioles.Tuesday marks the beginning of an eight-game homestand, a 16-game jaunt without an off day and 19 consecutive contests against clubs with records above .500. Of their 45 games remaining in the regular season, the Orioles only play 10 against sub-.500 teams, seven versus the Tampa Bay Rays and three versus the Arizona Diamondbacks.There are some favorable nuances in the remaining schedule \xe2\x80\x93 three off days in September, for instance \xe2\x80\x93 and some unfavorable things, such as non-division games against a trio of tough opponents: The Houston Astros, Detroit Tigers and National League East power Washington Nationals.Ultimately, the Orioles control their own destiny. Win at their current pace, win enough in the division and on the road, and get into the playoffs. That, of course, is simplistic. Here are five things the Orioles must do to have a better chance at their third postseason in five years.***Bring down the AL EastThe ultimate goal is to get into the playoffs, no matter the manner of entrance. So winning the American League East is not essential. But the division crown is there for the taking. The Orioles play 31 of their final 45 games against division rivals: six versus the Toronto Blue Jays, seven versus the Rays and nine each against the Boston Red Sox and New York Yankees.The Orioles are currently 26-19 against AL East teams, the best record of the group. The Blue Jays have the second best mark at 27-21. The Blue Jays have won seven of 13 against the Orioles this season with six left to play \xe2\x80\x93 three each in Baltimore and Toronto.Obviously, the Orioles would love to get home-field advantage and force the Blue Jays into a one-game Wild Card matchup. A big help would be beating Toronto in four of the next six head-to-head matchups to win the season series.***Win on the roadThe Orioles are great at Camden Yards, better than any team in the AL at 39-17. Only the National League Central\xe2\x80\x99s Chicago Cubs have more home wins than the Orioles.But that road record, 27-34, is much less desirable. When I recently wrote about the Orioles\xe2\x80\x99 road troubles, one commentor on our Facebook page asked, almost defensively, \xe2\x80\x9cHow many teams are good on the road?\xe2\x80\x9dThe answer: Of the seven clubs currently playing .560 or better baseball, only the Orioles have a losing road record. It\xe2\x80\x99s just one of those baseball truisms \xe2\x80\x93 good teams win on the road. The Orioles have 20 games away from Camden Yards remaining, and they need to make the most of them. Not sure what the formula is \xe2\x80\x93 more focus? \xe2\x80\x93 but it\xe2\x80\x99s imperative to turn more than half of those contests into victories.***Produce a quality lefty specialistThis is something the Orioles should have done at the beginning of the season, or when they released Brian Matusz or when Brian Duensing got hurt or when the trade deadline came and went.Orioles executive vice president Dan Duquette tried to acquire a lefty specialist in July, but the price was too hefty. Now, with versatile, right-handed set-up man Darren O\xe2\x80\x99Day on the shelf, adding someone who can retire left-handers late in games becomes more of a need. You can\xc2\xa0read more about my thoughts on that in this piece.The Orioles are hoping that 25-year-old rookie Donnie Hart, a 27th round pick in 2013, can do the job; lefties are just 1-for-11 against him in five games (right-handers are 2-for-4 in the big leagues versus Hart).And maybe Hart can be the guy. But since he has never been in such high-pressure situations in the past, it certainly wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t hurt to add someone who has done it more often on a big stage. There\xe2\x80\x99s still a shot a lefty specialist can be acquired in a trade this month, or maybe Duquette will have to reach into his magic hat and pull out another candidate from parts unknown. But further bolstering the bullpen \xe2\x80\x93 the club\xe2\x80\x99s true strength \xe2\x80\x93 will go a long way in keeping the Orioles on the playoff path.***Dylan Bundy has started six games this season.\xc2\xa0(Photo: Tommy Gilligan, USA TODAY Sports)Get consistency from rotationThis has been the biggest concern all year. Yet since the All-Star Break, the rotation has been solid, certainly enough to put the team in position to win. But, frankly, it\xe2\x80\x99s still a bit of a mystery.Chris Tillman has been exceptionally consistent and Dylan Bundy has been a savior since being inserted into the rotation. But you\xe2\x80\x99re not being fully honest if you say you know what you\xe2\x80\x99re going to get from Yovani Gallardo, Kevin Gausman and Wade Miley each time on the mound.Gallardo has thrown quality starts in three of his last five outings, but the occasional, rocky five-inning performance is squarely in his portfolio. Gausman has dominant stuff, but can\xe2\x80\x99t always harness it. And Miley has been OK, good and flat-out awful in his three starts since being traded to the Orioles on July 31.Everyone wants a formidable rotation; a solid, consistent one would be enough to get the Orioles into the postseason.***Light a fire under Chris DavisIt\xe2\x80\x99s probably unfair to single out one player on this list. But this one player has been the Most Valuable Oriole two times in the past three seasons and signed a $161 million contract in the offseason.Since the All-Star Break, the offense has had its share of missteps; it\xe2\x80\x99s s not just one guy. But Chris Davis has been the poster boy for the struggles. He\xe2\x80\x99s hitting .160 with a .295 on-base percentage and .234 slugging percentage in 27 second-half games \xe2\x80\x93 and that includes a recent run in which he had three consecutive, two-hit performances. But Davis followed up that streak with six strikeouts in his last seven at-bats. He\xe2\x80\x99s struck out 162 times (and has 67 walks) in 486 plate appearances.By now, you know what you get with Davis. And, oftentimes, what you get is a big finish. In his career, he\xe2\x80\x99s best at the end of the season. He\xe2\x80\x99s hit .294 with a .369 on-base percentage and .554 slugging percentage \xe2\x80\x93 all career highs for a month \xe2\x80\x94 after Sept. 1.And that\xe2\x80\x99s what the Orioles need this year. Davis missed the end of 2014 \xe2\x80\x93 the last time the club made the playoffs \xe2\x80\x93 due to his suspension for using the ADHD drug Adderall. He so badly wants to celebrate with his team this year \xe2\x80\x93 and if he gets going like he can, the odds of the Orioles having a September celebration is much, much better.Connolly writes for BaltimoreBaseball.com, an affiliate of USA TODAY Sports Media Group.CONNECTTWEET                              2                      LINKEDINCOMMENTEMAILMORE ', 'www.usatoday.com')]

[('Boston Red Sox at Baltimore Orioles - USA TODAY', 'If the Baltimore Orioles want to stay with the Boston Red Sox and keep the pressure on the Toronto Blue Jays in the American League East, they are going to need to find a way to slow down Mookie Betts. The Red Sox will try to ride Betts to a sweep of the brief two-game series when they visit the Orioles on Wednesday.Betts has seven home runs in five games at Baltimore this season, including a three-run shot and a two-run blast on Tuesday that accounted for all of Boston\xe2\x80\x99s runs in the 5-3 triumph. The budding superstar is 7-for-13 with five homers and 13 RBIs in the last three games overall and has been dropped into the cleanup spot in the order to provide even more RBI opportunities as the Red Sox fight for a playoff spot. The Orioles dropped into a tie with Boston for the first wild card spot and both teams sit one game behind the Blue Jays in the East. Baltimore is 2-2 so far on a brutal stretch of schedule that features 22 straight games against teams with winning records.TV: 7:05 p.m. ET, ESPN, NESN (Boston), MASN 2 (Baltimore)PITCHING MATCHUP: Red Sox LH David Price (10-8, 4.29 ERA) vs. Orioles RH Dylan Bundy (6-3, 2.93)Price snapped a five-start winless streak by holding the Arizona Diamondbacks to three runs on 10 hits and one walk in eight innings on Friday. The former Cy Young Award winner has not won on the road since May 18 and is 3-5 with a 4.34 ERA in 12 starts away from Fenway Park this season. Price went eight innings at home against Baltimore on June 14 and stuck out 11 but absorbed the loss while allowing three runs and five hits.Bundy is getting pushed up a day in place of righty Chris Tillman, who was scratched due to shoulder discomfort and likely won\xe2\x80\x99t pitch until the weekend. Bundy is riding a streak of three straight wins and breezed through 5 2/3 innings at San Francisco on Friday, allowing one run on three hits and two walks. The Oklahoma native is making his first career start against Boston and allowed two runs and 10 hits spread across four previous relief appearances against the Red Sox.WALK-OFFS1. Red Sox 3B Aaron Hill (forearm tightness) was scratched from Tuesday\xe2\x80\x99s lineup and is day-to-day.2. Orioles 1B Chris Davis is 0-for-9 with eight strikeouts in the last three games.3. Boston manager John Farrell spoke personally with free agent RHP Jonathan Papelbon about a possible return, and the veteran is expected to pick a team on Wednesday.PREDICTION: Red Sox 5, Orioles 3 If the Baltimore Orioles want to stay with the Boston Red Sox and keep the pressure on the Toronto Blue Jays in the American League East, they are going to need to find a way to slow down Mookie Betts. The Red Sox will try to ride Betts to a sweep of the brief two-game series when they visit the Orioles on Wednesday.Betts has seven home runs in five games at Baltimore this season, including a three-run shot and a two-run blast on Tuesday that accounted for all of Boston\xe2\x80\x99s runs in the 5-3 triumph.
