Tune in on 105.7 The Fan (no streaming). \xe2\x80\x94\xe2\x80\x94\xe2\x80\x94\xe2\x80\x94\xe2\x80\x94\xe2\x80\x94\xe2\x80\x94\xe2\x80\x94\xe2\x80\x94\xe2\x80\x94\xe2\x80\x94\xe2\x80\x94\xe2\x80\x94\xe2\x80\x94\xe2\x80\x94\xe2\x80\x94\xe2\x80\x94\xe2\x80\x94\xe2\x80\x94\xe2\x80\x94\xe2\x80\x94\xe2\x80\x94\xe2\x80\x94\xe2\x80\x94\xe2\x80\x94\xe2\x80\x94\xe2\x80\x94\xe2\x80\x94\xe2\x80\x94\xe2\x80\x94\xe2\x80\x94\xe2\x80\x94\xe2\x80\x94\xe2\x80\x94\xe2\x80\x94\xe2\x80\x94\xe2\x80\x94\xe2\x80\x94\xe2\x80\x94\xe2\x80\x94\xe2\x80\x94\xe2\x80\x94\xe2\x80\x94\xe2\x80\x94\xe2\x80\x94\xe2\x80\x94\xe2\x80\x94\xe2\x80\x94\xe2\x80\x94\xe2\x80\x94\xe2\x80\x94\xe2\x80\x94\xe2\x80\x94\xe2\x80\x94\xe2\x80\x94\xe2\x80\x94  When: 7:07 PM\xc2\xa0ET,\xc2\xa0Thursday, September 29, 2016 Where: Rogers Centre, Toronto, Ontario  By SportsDirect Inc. The Baltimore Orioles stayed alive in the battle for the top American League wild card spot and put themselves in position to pull even with the Toronto Blue Jays atop the standings with a dramatic victory on Wednesday. The Orioles can earn that tie and keep some space between themselves and the rest of the AL wild card contenders when they visit the Blue Jays in the rubber match of the three-game series on Thursday. Toronto was on the verge of a three-game lead in the standings before the bullpen had a little trouble closing out a two-run lead on Wednesday, and the recent struggles of Jason Grilli and Robert Osuna in the late innings are a concern. Grilli has allowed five runs while recording three outs in his last two appearances while Osuna was hit with a blown save in two of his last three games. Hyun Soo Kim\xe2\x80\x99s pinch-hit, two-run blast off Osuna in the ninth on Wednesday was the deciding factor in the win and left Baltimore one game ahead of the Detroit Tigers and two clear of the Seattle Mariners in the race for the second wild card. The Orioles finish the regular season with three games at the New York Yankees over the weekend while the Blue Jays travel to Boston. TV: 7:07 p.m. ET, MASN (Baltimore), Sportsnet (Toronto) PITCHING MATCHUP: Orioles RH Ubaldo Jimenez (7-12, 5.71 ERA) vs. Blue Jays RH Marcus Stroman (9-9, 4.34) Jimenez has been solid since returning to the rotation late in August and posted quality starts in four of his last six turns. The Dominican Republic native went at least six frames in the first five of those outings but lasted only 5 1/3 innings against Boston in his last start on Sept. 21 and was hit with the loss while allowing two unearned runs on four hits and four walks. Jimenez limited Toronto to three runs in 6 2/3 innings without factoring in the decision on Aug. 30. Stroman has not won since Aug. 14 despite allowing three or fewer earned runs in six of his last seven turns. The best start of the bunch came against the New York Yankees on Saturday, when the Duke product surrendered one hit in seven innings but was held out of the decision in a game the Blue Jays went on to win 3-0. Stroman last saw Baltimore on June 19 and was lit up for seven runs and 10 hits in 3 2/3 innings. WALK-OFFS 1. Blue Jays 2B Devon Travis (shoulder) sat out the last two games. 2. Baltimore LHP Zach Britton turned in his 13th straight scoreless appearance for his 47th save on Wednesday. 3. Toronto CF Ezequiel Carrera is 9-for-18 with six runs scored in his last five starts. PREDICTION: Blue Jays 5, Orioles 2  var addthis_product = \'wpp-261\'; var addthis_config = {"data_track_clickback":true};if (typeof(addthis_share) == "undefined"){ addthis_share = {"url_transforms":{"shorten":{"twitter":"bitly"}},"shorteners":{"bitly":{"login":"cbslocal","apiKey":"R_bfe2742f79bb4091b0fcfbdf5c6a81ca"}}};}  ', 'baltimore.cbslocal.com'), ('Ubaldo Jimenez, Orioles blank Blue Jays to move into wild ...', 'Orioles starting pitcher Ubaldo Jimenez (31) throws during the first inning against the Blue Jays.(Photo: Nick Turchiaro, USA TODAY Sports)CONNECTTWEETLINKEDINCOMMENTEMAILMORETORONTO \xe2\x80\x94 Ubaldo Jimenez is rounding into form at the right time for the Baltimore Orioles.Jimenez and two relievers combined on a three-hitter and the Orioles beat the Blue Jays 4-0 on Thursday night, moving into a tie with Toronto in the AL wild card race with three games remaining.\xe2\x80\x9c(Jimenez) was in command pretty much all night,\xe2\x80\x9d Orioles catcher Matt Wieters said. \xe2\x80\x9cIn a big game like that, he really kept his emotions under control like I knew he would. He threw the ball great.\xe2\x80\x9dWhen he last started at Toronto on June 12, Jimenez allowed five runs and six hits in 1/3 of an inning, the shortest start of his career.\xe2\x80\x9cWhatever happened to me in the past, I don\xe2\x80\x99t even think about that,\xe2\x80\x9d Jimenez said. \xe2\x80\x9cIf you get stuck in the past, you\xe2\x80\x99re not going to be able to move on. Whether it\xe2\x80\x99s good or bad, you have to find a way to look forward.\xe2\x80\x9dThe right-hander made his return a triumphant one, carving up the Blue Jays for 6\xe2\x85\x94 innings. The only hit he allowed was Ezequiel Carrera\xe2\x80\x99s single to begin the first. Josh Donaldson followed with a walk but Jimenez retired the next six batters in order.\xe2\x80\x9cBoy, he was solid,\xe2\x80\x9d Orioles manager Buck Showalter said. \xe2\x80\x9cIt was big to get a positive feeling early on. It was fun to watch him.\xe2\x80\x9dDevon Travis walked to open the third and advanced on Carrera\xe2\x80\x99s sacrifice, but that was the first of 11 consecutive outs for Jimenez, a streak that ended with Edwin Encarnacion\xe2\x80\x99s two-out walk in the sixth. Jose Bautista flied out to end the inning.Jimenez (8-12) improved to 3-1 with a 2.31 ERA in five September starts. He walked three and struck out five.Donnie Hart got one out in the seventh and Brad Brach finished.The Orioles visit New York for the final weekend of the season, while the Blue Jays head to Boston to face the AL East champion Red Sox.Detroit, which was rained out Thursday, is 1\xc2\xbd\xc2\xa0games behind the Orioles and Blue Jays.     .oembed-asset-link { background: #fff; border-bottom: 1px solid #e1e1e1; }     .oembed-link-anchor { display: block; clear: both; }     .oembed-link-thumbnail{ float: left; padding: 14px; }     .oembed-link-thumbnail img { max-width: 78px; max-height: 60px; display: block; }     p.oembed-link-title { font-size: 75%; color: #009BFF; margin: 0 14px; padding-top: 12px; font-weight:normal; text-align: left; line-height: 120%;  }     p.oembed-link-desc { font-size: 100%; color: #666; font-weight: normal; margin: 0 14px 14px 14px; font-family: \'Futura Today Light\'; text-align: left; line-height: 120%; } USA TODAYBlue Jays bullpen a concern in AL wild card chaseBaltimore trailed through eight innings on Wednesday before winning 3-2 on Hyun Soo Kim\xe2\x80\x99s two-run homer in the ninth. Thanks to Jimenez\xe2\x80\x99s effort on Thursday, the Orioles have won five of six.\xe2\x80\x9cThis time of year, momentum is huge,\xe2\x80\x9d Wieters said. \xe2\x80\x9cOver 162 (games), momentum is going to come and go but once you start getting close to the playoffs, momentum is big. We\xe2\x80\x99re going to try and keep it going as long as we can.\xe2\x80\x9dManny Machado opened the scoring with a sacrifice fly in the third, Michael Bourn\xe2\x80\x99s fielder\xe2\x80\x99s choice grounder made it 2-0 in the fourth and Bourn scored on Kim\xe2\x80\x99s two-out single in the seventh.Mark Trumbo doubled to begin the eighth and Wieters chased Marcus Stroman with an RBI single.Stroman (9-10) gave up nine hits and four runs in seven-plus innings, reaching the 200-inning plateau for the first time. Stroman is winless in eight starts.\xe2\x80\x9cWe\xe2\x80\x99re hoping our luck starts to turn,\xe2\x80\x9d Stroman said. \xe2\x80\x9cWe\xe2\x80\x99re hoping to go into Boston and come out firing.\xe2\x80\x9dFIRING BLANKSThe Orioles have nine shutouts this season. The past six have come against AL East opponents.DRAWING POWERThe crowd of 47,791 was Toronto\xe2\x80\x99s 39th sellout. The Blue Jays drew an AL-high 3,392,099 this season.TRAINER\xe2\x80\x99S ROOMBlue Jays: Travis returned after sitting out the previous two games. He jammed his surgically repaired shoulder in Monday\xe2\x80\x99s benches-clearing brawl with New York.UP NEXTOrioles: Yovani Gallardo left Toronto on Thursday afternoon to fly to New York, where he will start Friday night against the Yankees. Gallardo (5-8, 5.63) allowed eight runs, seven earned, in 1 1/3 innings in his previous start at New York, a 14-4 loss on Aug. 26. RHP Michael Pineda (6-11, 4.68) starts for the Yankees.Blue Jays: RHP Marco Estrada will start against the Red Sox on Friday night as Toronto wraps up the regular season in Boston. Estrada has allowed one run and five hits in 14 innings over his previous two outings. Rick Porcello (22-4, 3.11) starts for the Red Sox.GALLERY: MLB PHOTO OF THE DAYFacebookTwitterGoogle+LinkedInMLB photo of the day\xc2\xa0FullscreenPost to FacebookPosted!A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. [('Baseball - Orioles down Blue Jays to bolster playoff pursuit', "TORONTO, CANADA - SEPTEMBER 29: Ubaldo Jimenez #31 of the Baltimore Orioles delivers a pitch in the first inning during MLB game action against the Toronto Blue Jays on September 29, 2016 at Rogers Centre in Toronto, Ontario, Canada. Tom Szczerbowski/Getty Images/AFPTORONTO, CANADA - SEPTEMBER 29: Ubaldo Jimenez #31 of the Baltimore Orioles delivers a pitch in the first inning during MLB game action against the Toronto Blue Jays on September 29, 2016 at Rogers Centre in Toronto, Ontario, Canada. Tom Szczerbowski/Getty Images/AFP (AFP Photo/Tom Szczerbowski)More- Ubaldo Jimenez allowed one hit in 6 2/3 scoreless innings Thursday as the Baltimore Orioles beat the Blue Jays 4-0 to tie Toronto for the first American League wild card berth. The Orioles took the rubber match of the three-game series in Toronto after the Blue Jays took the opener. The St. Louis Cardinals kept their bid for a National League wild card berth going by rallying for a 4-3 victory over the Cincinnati Reds on Yadier Molina's two-out run-batted-in double in the bottom of the ninth inning. The Cardinals pulled within two games of the idle New York Mets for the National League's first wild-card spot and within a half-game of San Francisco for the second wild card spot.AFP ", 'www.yahoo.com'), ('Baltimore Orioles: Ubaldo Jimenez pitches Birds closer to ...', "Ubaldo Jimenez pitched six plus innings of one-hit baseball as the Baltimore Orioles tied Toronto for the top wild card spot.As maligned as Ubaldo Jimenez has been by Baltimore Orioles fans over time, you have to admit that he normally shows up when he\xe2\x80\x99s needed most. I would point back to the 2014 AL East clincher against Toronto, where Jimenez started out of the bullpen and came up big for the Birds. He\xe2\x80\x99s also had several big starts over the past couple of weeks, which brought him and the Orioles to last night\xe2\x80\xa6,,,ironically against Toronto once again. Jimenez\xe2\x80\x99s line: 6.2 IP, 1 H, 0 R, 3 BB, 5 K. Anytime a pitcher goes as long as Jimenez went into that game and tosses a one-hitter, he\xe2\x80\x99s really on his game. Jimenez certainly struggled for much of the 2016 season. However he\xe2\x80\x99s what you\xe2\x80\x99d call a big-game late-season pitcher. He steps it up when he needs to.Some fans might justifiably point out that perhaps had Jimenez been on his game earlier the Orioles might not still be trying to wrap up a playoff spot at this point. But the point is that when he\xe2\x80\x99s called in a big spot late in the year, Jimenez has proven that he shows up. And that\xe2\x80\x99s a good guy to have on your team.Live Feed Baltimore OriolesBaltimore Orioles: Chris Tillman's return was a welcomed one in Baltimore The Baltimore WireBaltimore Orioles: Injury update on Orioles starting pitcher Wade Miley The Baltimore WireCurt Schilling Continues to be an Embarrassment Call to the PenBaltimore Orioles: Chris Tillman season debut scheduled for Sunday Call to the PenFantasy Baseball 2017: Zach Britton back on 10-day DL Fantasy Baseball CrackerjacksBaltimore Orioles Acquire Jordan Kipper from Angels The Baltimore WireThe Orioles took a 1-0 lead in the third on Manny Machado\xe2\x80\x99s sac fly-RBI. Michael Bourn grounded into a fielder\xe2\x80\x99s choice-RBI an inning later, and the Birds led 2-0. RBI-singles by Kim and Wieters in the seventh and eighth innings closed out the scoring, and the Birds took a 4-0 victory into the clubhouse.WIth the win, the Orioles are now tied with Toronto in the American League Wild Card standings. Whichever team finishes with the better win percentage will host the wild card game, which is scheduled for next Tuesday night. If the two teams finish tied, Toronto wins the tie-breaker. Toronto finishes their season in Boston, while the Orioles of course are down the pike in New York.Notice that I said the wild card game is\xc2\xa0scheduled\xc2\xa0for Tuesday. In theory that could be up in the air if tie-breakers come into play. The Orioles\xe2\x80\x99 magic number to clinch a playoff spot is three. However Detroit (who\xe2\x80\x99s chasing the Birds) was rained out yesterday at home in their game against Cleveland. That game would in theory be made up on Monday\xc2\xa0if it\xe2\x80\x99s needed.If the Orioles can eliminate Detroit before then, that game will be irrelevant. However if Detroit is still within a half-game of overtaking or tying the Orioles, it would need to be made up. And that\xe2\x80\x99s where it gets murky; if that game is made up on Monday and after the fact the Orioles (or Toronto for that matter) and Detroit are tied, then what happens? In that case they\xe2\x80\x99d have to play a tie-breaker game, which in reality would be\xc2\xa0regular season game 163.More from Orioles News2/20 - Baltimore Orioles: Adding Vidal Nuno helps fill out bullpen2/19 - Baltimore Orioles: Manny Machado and O\xe2\x80\x99s have not discussed extension2/19 - Baltimore Orioles: O\xe2\x80\x99s receive good news about J.J. Hardy\xe2\x80\x99s back2/19 - Baltimore Orioles: Orioles sign Craig Gentry to minor-league deal2/17 - Baltimore Orioles: Chris Johnson wants to revitalize his careerSo when does that happen? Obviously MLB has a nightmare scenario in that situation, because they\xe2\x80\x99d probably need to reshuffle the schedule a bit. However my prediction is that it won\xe2\x80\x99t be an issue. While Detroit is playing Atlanta this weekend, any combination of Orioles (or Toronto) wins and Detroit losses which equal three eliminates Detroit. So if the Birds take two-of-three in NYC and Detroit drops at least one game in Atlanta, that\xe2\x80\x99s the end of it.Obviously if the Orioles sweep the series in NY it would be over as well. So at this point I\xe2\x80\x99m predicting the Orioles as a playoff team, but without the theatrics which a lot of folks are saying could happen. Here\xe2\x80\x99s a good way to look at it; if the Orioles and Atlanta win tonight, then an Oriole or an Atlanta win tomorrow will put the Orioles in the playoffs.Next: Baltimore Orioles: Hyun-Soo Kim saved his best for lastThe aforementioned penultimate series in New York begins tonight at Yankee Stadium. Yovani Gallardo gets the ball for the Orioles\xe2\x80\x99 and he\xe2\x80\x99ll be opposed by New York\xe2\x80\x99s Michael Pineda. Game time is set for just after 7 PM \xe2\x80\x93 weather permitting. Oh, did I mention that the forecast in NY this weekend had it\xe2\x80\x99s toils and snares?! ", 'birdswatcher.com')]

                    });                 });             }          } })();  BALTIMORE \xe2\x80\x94 In the middle of the seventh inning of the Baltimore Orioles\xe2\x80\x99 game against the Arizona Diamondbacks two Friday nights ago, the public-address announcer asked the crowd at Camden Yards to stand and celebrate America\xe2\x80\x99s diversity. Three singers then stood on the first-base dugout and did a rendition of \xe2\x80\x9cThis Land Is Your Land,\xe2\x80\x9d the famous folk song written by Woody Guthrie.By the time the end of the third verse arrived \xe2\x80\x94 \xe2\x80\x9cAll around me a voice was sounding, this land was made for you and me\xe2\x80\x9d \xe2\x80\x94 fans had joined in.In a tradition that dates to the aftermath of the Sept. 11 terror attacks in 2001, \xe2\x80\x9cGod Bless America\xe2\x80\x9d is played in major league ballparks around the country, including in Baltimore, during the seventh-inning stretch of Sunday games. The song can also be heard during assorted holiday games, and the Yankees play the song during the seventh inning of every home game.But Baltimore is the only major league franchise to regularly play \xe2\x80\x9cThis Land Is Your Land,\xe2\x80\x9d which it does at Friday home games. And the song, long considered an anthem of the left because of its populist themes, is meant to be more than a Camden Yards singalong. It is a subtle, yet intentional, message from the Orioles\xe2\x80\x99 management that at the intersection of sports and patriotism, one size does not have to fit all. Continue reading the main story        Advertisement  Continue reading the main story      \xe2\x80\x9c\xe2\x80\x98God Bless America\xe2\x80\x99 speaks to a lot of people,\xe2\x80\x9d said John Angelos, the Orioles\xe2\x80\x99 chief operating officer and the son of the team\xe2\x80\x99s owner, Peter Angelos. But, he added, \xe2\x80\x9cthere is a strain of progressivism in American life, and if we can reflect it, I think that\xe2\x80\x99s a good thing.\xe2\x80\x9d  Advertisement  Continue reading the main story  The Orioles began occasionally playing Guthrie\xe2\x80\x99s song in the 2015 season. This year, they made it a staple on Fridays, which means it was in place before San Francisco 49ers quarterback Colin Kaepernick focused attention on a nationwide debate when he declined to stand for the national anthem before an N.F.L. exhibition game in August.Kaepernick cited racial oppression as the reason for his action, which paved the way for symbolic gestures by other athletes, some who have knelt during the anthem, others who have linked arms while standing at attention and still others who have raised a clenched fist.Set against all this is Guthrie\xe2\x80\x99s song, which the Orioles, who finish the season at Yankee Stadium, will have a chance to play again this year only if the team makes it to the playoffs. Regardless, they plan to keep playing \xe2\x80\x9cThis Land\xe2\x80\x9d next season. In the meantime, Angelos is keeping a close eye on all the ripple effects created by Kaepernick. Photo       Woody Guthrie, above, who was known for his songs about the downtrodden, wrote \xe2\x80\x9cThis Land Is Your Land\xe2\x80\x9d in 1940 as an answer to Irving Berlin\xe2\x80\x99s \xe2\x80\x9cGod Bless America.\xe2\x80\x9d  Credit             Associated Press           \xe2\x80\x9cI hope people in the sports industry are learning from what Colin Kaepernick is doing,\xe2\x80\x9d he said. \xe2\x80\x9cI hope we can learn that speaking out about your country is not un-American, that words like \xe2\x80\x98un-American\xe2\x80\x99 have no place.\xe2\x80\x9d  Advertisement  Continue reading the main story  As for the criticism Kaepernick has faced, Angelos called it \xe2\x80\x9cdisgusting.\xe2\x80\x9d \xe2\x80\x9cIt reeks of McCarthyism,\xe2\x80\x9d he said.  Advertisement  Continue reading the main story  The history of Guthrie\xe2\x80\x99s tune is linked to \xe2\x80\x9cGod Bless America,\xe2\x80\x9d which was written by Irving Berlin and then recorded by Kate Smith in 1938, when it became a hit at a time of uneasiness in the years leading up to World War II.Guthrie, who had spent years traveling the country during the Great Depression, had Communist sympathies and a different, more defiant, vision of the United States than the one conveyed in \xe2\x80\x9cGod Bless America.\xe2\x80\x9d As an answer to that song, he wrote \xe2\x80\x9cThis Land Is Your Land\xe2\x80\x9d in 1940.His original lyrics questioned the merits of private property and included lines that were never officially recorded: \xe2\x80\x9cBy the relief office, I saw my people. As they stood there hungry, I stood there wondering if this land was made for you and me.\xe2\x80\x9d Through the years, the song was popularized by Guthrie\xe2\x80\x99s son, Arlo, and others, including Pete Seeger and Bruce Springsteen. Privacy Policy    John Shaw, the author of \xe2\x80\x9cThis Land That I Love,\xe2\x80\x9d a book about the two songs, said the two songwriters had more in common than meets the eye. Although \xe2\x80\x9cGod Bless America\xe2\x80\x9d has become associated with unvarnished patriotism, that was not Berlin\xe2\x80\x99s intent. When the song was written, Shaw said, it was Berlin\xe2\x80\x99s way of showing gratitude that he was no longer in Europe. \xe2\x80\x9cIt\xe2\x80\x99s a love letter written by an immigrant to his adopted country,\xe2\x80\x9d Shaw said.  Advertisement  Continue reading the main story  As for Guthrie, Shaw noted that while the original lyrics were a sarcastic response to Berlin\xe2\x80\x99s song, \xe2\x80\x9cThis Land Is Your Land\xe2\x80\x9d evolved, too. \xe2\x80\x9cIt became a love song to America, too,\xe2\x80\x9d Shaw said.  Advertisement  Continue reading the main story  In the aftermath of the Sept. 11 attacks, major league teams began playing Berlin\xe2\x80\x99s song as a show of patriotism. But Angelos also thought about how the Orioles could diversify the way they honored America. For instance, the team now has a program to honor community heroes at Friday, Saturday and Sunday home games. Photo       John Angelos, the Orioles\xe2\x80\x99 chief operating officer, said, \xe2\x80\x9cThere is a strain of progressivism in American life, and if we can reflect it, I think that\xe2\x80\x99s a good thing.\xe2\x80\x9d  Credit             Todd Olszewski/Orioles           The core of the idea was to celebrate various citizens, and not just members of the military, and pair each day with a different song (\xe2\x80\x9cAmerica the Beautiful\xe2\x80\x9d is played on Saturdays). Last Friday, the community hero was a bus driver, Reneita Smith, who saved a group of elementary students from a burning school bus.  Advertisement  Continue reading the main story  \xe2\x80\x9cPeople forget a lot of these stadiums are publicly funded buildings and, by law, they have to welcome people from all different walks of life,\xe2\x80\x9d Angelos said. \xe2\x80\x9cSometimes sports can be narrowcast in the causes and groups focused on. Our idea is that everyone should be included; let\xe2\x80\x99s not leave anyone out.\xe2\x80\x9dThat the Orioles are taking this approach is not all that surprising. Peter Angelos made his fortune representing workers in asbestos cases. He refused to sign replacement players during the strike by players in 1994 and 1995, and he helped arrange for the Orioles to play a home-and-home series with the Cuban national team in 1999 at a time when there was no active relationship between the countries.  Advertisement  Continue reading the main story  During protests over the death of Freddie Gray, a black man killed while in the custody of the Baltimore police last year, John Angelos spoke publicly about needing to put the demonstrations within the context of longstanding racial inequality.\xe2\x80\x9cThis family, these owners, have always been on the side of the unions, of the people,\xe2\x80\x9d Orioles center fielder Adam Jones said in reference to the Angeloses. \xe2\x80\x9cThe city means something to them.\xe2\x80\x9d  Advertisement  Continue reading the main story  Still, for most Orioles fans at Camden Yards, \xe2\x80\x9cThis Land\xe2\x80\x9d remains a song and not much more. Jones, who recently said that athlete protests over the national anthem had not spread to baseball because of a lack of racial diversity in the sport, said he was not conversant with the song\xe2\x80\x99s political history.  Advertisement  Continue reading the main story  Several fans, asked about the song\xe2\x80\x99s meaning last week, also pleaded ignorance. \xe2\x80\x9cI doubt most of our guys know who Woody Guthrie is,\xe2\x80\x9d Manager Buck Showalter added.  For his part, John Angelos said it did not bother him that many fans and players may not know the song\xe2\x80\x99s origins because it was only one aspect of the community heroes program.\xe2\x80\x9cWe can honor a veteran, but we can also honor a veteran who is against a particular war,\xe2\x80\x9d he said. \xe2\x80\x9cThat diversity is what the song represents.\xe2\x80\x9d  A version of this article appears in print on October 1, 2016, on Page D3 of the New York edition with the headline: In Baltimore, This Song Is Their Song.                     });                 });             }          } })();  Jonathan Schoop finished his interview in the Baltimore Orioles\xe2\x80\x99 clubhouse Friday night, then peeked over the heads of the reporters by his locker. The televisions in the middle of the room were showing the final inning of the Toronto Blue Jays\xe2\x80\x99 game in Boston. The Jays were down to their last out.\xe2\x80\x9cStrike him out,\xe2\x80\x9d said Schoop, who had just driven in five runs against the Yankees. But his heart was not really in it. He left the room before the Red Sox obliged, lifting the Orioles into the top spot in the American League wild-card race. The Orioles have reason to be confident; if they keep winning, they will need no help to host a game at Camden Yards next week.With a soggy 8-1 victory over the Yankees in the Bronx \xe2\x80\x94 and the Blue Jays\xe2\x80\x99 5-3 loss at Fenway Park \xe2\x80\x94 the Orioles now stand a game ahead of the Blue Jays. They nearly fell three back on Wednesday, before a ninth-inning, pinch-hit homer by Hyun Soo Kim in Toronto.\xe2\x80\x9cI thought we were going to win that game, frankly,\xe2\x80\x9d said Dan Duquette, the Orioles\xe2\x80\x99 executive vice president for baseball operations. \xe2\x80\x9cI really did, because we\xe2\x80\x99d played a good game. We played good defense, we got good pitching. We still had a shot. And that was a terrific at-bat by Kim.\xe2\x80\x9d Continue reading the main story        Advertisement  Continue reading the main story      Now the Orioles have won six of their last seven. At 88-72, they can clinch one of the wild-card spots with a victory on Saturday and a loss by the Detroit Tigers. That would be a tidier outcome than a slew of other possibilities.  Advertisement  Continue reading the main story  If Toronto pulls even with the Orioles at the end of the regular season, the Blue Jays will host the wild-card game on Tuesday because they won the teams\xe2\x80\x99 season series. But if Detroit is just a half-game ahead or behind after Sunday, the Tigers will have to make up a rained-out game against Cleveland on Monday. That could set up a three-way tie for two spots.Other possible outcomes are in play, too. The Seattle Mariners are still alive, and the Tigers, conceivably, could play five games in five cities from Sunday through Thursday. It is a lot to process. Privacy Policy    \xe2\x80\x9cWe could be playing Monday, we could be playing Tuesday, we could be playing Wednesday \xe2\x80\x94 and we could not be playing at all,\xe2\x80\x9d Orioles Manager Buck Showalter said Friday afternoon, as rain washed out batting practice. \xe2\x80\x9cThe focus is trying to win these nine innings tonight, believe me. There\xe2\x80\x99s a lot of different things that will cloud your mind if you let them.\xe2\x80\x9d  Advertisement  Continue reading the main story  The Orioles are striving for another shot at their first championship since 1983. They lead the A.L. in victories and home runs \xe2\x80\x94 while committing the fewest errors \xe2\x80\x94 since the start of the 2012 season. But they have not advanced past the A.L. Championship Series. The Kansas City Royals swept them in that round two years ago.  Advertisement  Continue reading the main story  \xe2\x80\x9cIf you get in the tournament, who knows, right?\xe2\x80\x9d Duquette said. \xe2\x80\x9cSome of the teams that get into the tournament as a wild card, they do pretty well. Just got to win a couple more games and get into the tournament and take our chances.\xe2\x80\x9d  Advertisement  Continue reading the main story  The Orioles have gotten this far with extremes: They lead the majors in home runs, and have stolen the fewest bases. They have by far the most home runs, with 250, but have just 19 stolen bases and six triples, which would be the fewest ever by a team in a season.Yet the Orioles\xe2\x80\x99 power and bullpen \xe2\x80\x94 anchored by the incomparable Zach Britton \xe2\x80\x94 have been enough to overcome the lack of speed, and a rotation with a 4.74 E.R.A. Every team with a higher starters\xe2\x80\x99 E.R.A. has a losing record. The Orioles have found a way, but this was not part of some master plan.\xe2\x80\x9cWe just try to get the best players we can get,\xe2\x80\x9d Duquette said. \xe2\x80\x9cSometimes the value\xe2\x80\x99s in the relief pitchers. Sometimes it\xe2\x80\x99s in the power hitters. We\xe2\x80\x99ve tried to develop some good starters, which we\xe2\x80\x99re making progress on. So we\xe2\x80\x99re just trying to get the best players we can for the value, that\xe2\x80\x99s all.\xe2\x80\x9d  Advertisement  Continue reading the main story  The Orioles\xe2\x80\x99 reliance on power, without power arms in their rotation, could be a dubious formula for October success. Mark Trumbo, the major league leader in home runs, sounded almost apologetic Friday when asked about the Orioles\xe2\x80\x99 three-homer fifth inning, which included his 47th of the season.\xe2\x80\x9cThat\xe2\x80\x99s kind of what we\xe2\x80\x99ve proven we do,\xe2\x80\x9d Trumbo said. \xe2\x80\x9cEspecially going into the situation we\xe2\x80\x99re in, I like the execution just as much, though. From here on out, beyond the regular season, we\xe2\x80\x99re going to see pitching that\xe2\x80\x99s going to be top of the line, and it\xe2\x80\x99s important against guys of that caliber to be able to scrap together some runs.\xe2\x80\x9d  Advertisement  Continue reading the main story  As soon as Saturday, the Orioles could clinch their opportunity. Showalter likes what he sees.\xe2\x80\x9cOur guys, they\xe2\x80\x99re going to be able to have a real peace about the endgame here, because they\xe2\x80\x99ve given themselves every chance,\xe2\x80\x9d he said. \xe2\x80\x9cI can\xe2\x80\x99t say this about every team I\xe2\x80\x99ve had, but this team will be as good as it\xe2\x80\x99s capable of being \xe2\x80\x94 I feel like, anyway. They\xe2\x80\x99re a real trustworthy bunch.\xe2\x80\x9d  A version of this article appears in print on October 1, 2016, on Page D1 of the New York edition with the headline: Orioles  Set Off, Destination Unknown.                     });                 });             }          } })();  There is an award for the best relief pitcher in each league. It was first given by Major League Baseball in 2014. The American League\xe2\x80\x99s honor is named for Mariano Rivera, the National League\xe2\x80\x99s for Trevor Hoffman. Rivera, Hoffman and other decorated former closers do the voting.\xe2\x80\x9cBut it\xe2\x80\x99s not that highly touted,\xe2\x80\x9d said Zach Britton, the star closer for the Baltimore Orioles. \xe2\x80\x9cRarely do you even know who wins it. The Cy Young\xe2\x80\x99s always been the pinnacle of the pitcher\xe2\x80\x99s award. Coming up, I thought it was the starting pitcher award. I didn\xe2\x80\x99t know relievers had won it, just because there\xe2\x80\x99s been very few that have.\xe2\x80\x9dRelievers are eligible, and nine have won since baseball writers created the award in 1956. Usually, though, it goes to an ace starter who exhibits durability and dominance, like Washington\xe2\x80\x99s Max Scherzer, the clear choice in the N.L. this season.Scherzer was 19-7 with a 2.82 earned run average. He pitched like an ace more than anyone else, with a major-league-best 18 starts in which he lasted at least seven innings and allowed no more than two earned runs. His 0.940 walks plus hits per inning is the best in the league, as is his strikeout total, 277. Opponents managed a meager .248 on-base percentage against Scherzer. Continue reading the main story        Advertisement  Continue reading the main story      In the A.L., there has been no similar starter. Nobody had an E.R.A. below 3.00. Boston\xe2\x80\x99s Rick Porcello (22-4, 3.15) leads the league in walks plus hits per inning and strikeout-to-walk ratio, but Cleveland\xe2\x80\x99s Corey Kluber, the Chicago White Sox\xe2\x80\x99 Chris Sale and Detroit\xe2\x80\x99s Justin Verlander were dominant more often.  Advertisement  Continue reading the main story  Britton, meanwhile, has simply done his job better than any other pitcher in the A.L., going 47 for 47 in save opportunities. His 0.55 earned run average would be the lowest in baseball history for a pitcher who had thrown at least 65 innings.Britton has faced about 250 batters. Kluber, Porcello, Sale and Verlander have each faced more than three times that. But Britton\xe2\x80\x99s success in high-leverage situations has made him the league pitching leader in Win Probability Added, which measures how much a player affects the outcome of games.\xe2\x80\x9cI think it\xe2\x80\x99s all relative to nowadays, how the game is,\xe2\x80\x9d Britton said. \xe2\x80\x9cThe game is really built on big bullpens; we\xe2\x80\x99ve seen that with world champions. It\xe2\x80\x99s not built on rotations as much as it was. So I think, sometimes, it\xe2\x80\x99s hard to get people\xe2\x80\x99s heads to grasp that the game has evolved. People find that if you have a dominant bullpen, to an extent those guys affect more games than a good starter will, which is at most 30 or 35 games.\xe2\x80\x9d  Advertisement  Continue reading the main story  Britton came up as a starter but found his calling in the bullpen as a one-pitch marvel, with precision command of a heavy, darting sinker. He works many more games now, for shorter, intense bursts.  Advertisement  Continue reading the main story  \xe2\x80\x9cIt may be only 60 to 70 innings, but it\xe2\x80\x99s tough to ask somebody to be perfect over time,\xe2\x80\x9d Britton said. \xe2\x80\x9cAs a starter, you don\xe2\x80\x99t have that pressure.\xe2\x80\x9d  Advertisement  Continue reading the main story  Britton has achieved perfection, in a season when no A.L. starter has overwhelmed the field. No reliever has won the Cy Young Award since Eric Gagne, who was perfect in save chances for the Los Angeles Dodgers in 2003. Britton should be the next.N.L. runners-up: 2) Jon Lester, Cubs; 3) Kyle Hendricks, Cubs; 4) Jose Fernandez, Miami; 5) Madison Bumgarner, San Francisco.A.L. runners-up: 2) Rick Porcello, Boston; 3) Justin Verlander, Detroit; 4) Chris Sale, White Sox; 5) Corey Kluber, Cleveland. Photo       The Los Angeles Angels have a losing record, but Mike Trout\xe2\x80\x99s play may still merit M.V.P. honors.  Credit             Sean M. Haffey/Getty Images           A.L. Most Valuable PlayerMike Trout, Los Angeles AngelsMany voters link this award to team success, yet this guideline is detailed on every ballot: The M.V.P. need not come from a division winner or other playoff qualifier.  Advertisement  Continue reading the main story  There is a team award: the World Series trophy. This is an individual award. And no individual was better than Mike Trout. He did everything exceptionally well, and even brought stolen bases back to his game.Who is more valuable than Trout? Do not hold the Angels\xe2\x80\x99 threadbare roster or serious pitching injuries against him. The answer is that no player is more valuable. Yes, the Angels had a losing record with Trout. Without him, they would have been much worse. Whether his value helped his team win 90 games or 70 should not matter.  Advertisement  Continue reading the main story  Boston\xe2\x80\x99s Mookie Betts, another supremely well-rounded candidate, is very close. But Trout entered the weekend first in the A.L. in on-base percentage and second in slugging percentage. Betts ranked eighth in both. We should not overthink this. Nobody is better than Trout.Runners-up: 2) Mookie Betts, Boston; 3) Jose Altuve, Houston; 4) Josh Donaldson, Toronto; 5) David Ortiz, Boston; 6) Adrian Beltre, Texas; 7) Manny Machado, Baltimore; 8) Miguel Cabrera, Detroit; 9) Robinson Cano, Seattle; 10) Mark Trumbo, Baltimore.  Advertisement  Continue reading the main story  A.L. Rookie of the YearMichael Fulmer, Detroit TigersMichael Fulmer entered his start on Wednesday with a 2.95 earned run average. He needed just six and one-third innings to qualify for the E.R.A. title. On a rainy night in Detroit, he fell three innings short.Even so, coming that close to the E.R.A. title ought to earn Fulmer the A.L. Rookie of the Year Award. Fulmer, who went to the Tigers from the Mets for Yoenis Cespedes last summer, made 26 starts. In 21 of them, he allowed three runs or fewer. He should be rewarded for consistent quality from late April through late September.  Advertisement  Continue reading the main story  Gary Sanchez, the Yankees\xe2\x80\x99 slugging catcher, played just one game before Aug. 3. He never had to make the adjustments all players must face over the long season, so even to be runner-up is an achievement. Ryan Dull \xe2\x80\x94 the Oakland setup man who had held opponents to five hits in 68 at-bats with runners in scoring position through Thursday \xe2\x80\x94 also makes the ballot.  Advertisement  Continue reading the main story  Runners-up: 2) Gary Sanchez, Yankees; 3) Ryan Dull, Oakland.A.L. Manager of the YearTerry Francona, Cleveland IndiansTerry Francona won two championships with Boston but never received this award until he guided the low-payroll Indians to a wild-card berth in 2013. This season, he led Cleveland to its first American League Central crown in nine years, easily winning a division that included the reigning World Series champions (Kansas City) and a team loaded with stars (Detroit).The Indians\xe2\x80\x99 best hitter, Michael Brantley, played only 11 games. The team got almost no production from its catchers, and a vaunted rotation hobbled to the finish. But Francona put his players in position to succeed, and he was not scared to use his best reliever, Andrew Miller, to snuff out rallies before the ninth inning.  Advertisement  Continue reading the main story  Runners-up: 2) Buck Showalter, Baltimore; 3) Jeff Banister, Texas.N.L. Most Valuable PlayerKris Bryant, Chicago CubsKris Bryant is poised to follow up his rookie-of-the-year season with a runaway victory for M.V.P. He would become the fourth player to win those awards in consecutive seasons, after Cal Ripken Jr., Ryan Howard and Dustin Pedroia. (Fred Lynn and Ichiro Suzuki won them in the same season.)  Advertisement  Continue reading the main story  Bryant brings significant value with his bat; he hits for average, gets on base a lot and is one of the majors\xe2\x80\x99 top sluggers. But he gets extra credit for starting at four positions, personifying the value of versatility in today\xe2\x80\x99s game.It was tempting to endorse Colorado\xe2\x80\x99s Nolan Arenado, an exceptional defender at third base who strikes out a lot less often than Bryant does. But Arenado got a serious boost from playing at Coors Field, where he had a 1.032 on-base-plus-slugging percentage entering the weekend, compared with .832 on the road. Still, he ranks just behind Bryant and Daniel Murphy among N.L. stars this season.  Advertisement  Continue reading the main story  Runners-up: 2) Daniel Murphy, Washington; 3) Nolan Arenado, Colorado; 4) Freddie Freeman, Atlanta; 5) Anthony Rizzo, Cubs; 6) Yoenis Cespedes, Mets; 7) Joey Votto, Cincinnati; 8) Corey Seager, Dodgers; 9) Max Scherzer, Washington; 10) D. J. LeMahieu, Colorado.N.L. Rookie of the YearCorey Seager, Los Angeles DodgersKyle Seager, the Seattle Mariners\xe2\x80\x99 All-Star third baseman, said last spring that his younger brother, Corey, would improve. \xe2\x80\x9cFrom a talent standpoint,\xe2\x80\x9d Kyle said, \xe2\x80\x9che\xe2\x80\x99s definitely got a lot more to offer.\xe2\x80\x9dThe older brother knew best. Corey Seager, a 22-year-old Dodger, showed that he might be the premier N.L. shortstop for years to come. Just three other rookies in the last 40 years have hit .300 with at least 70 extra-base hits: Nomar Garciaparra (1997), Albert Pujols (2001) and Jose Abreu (2014). All unanimously won rookie of the year, and Seager will do so, too.  Advertisement  Continue reading the main story  Seager\xe2\x80\x99s teammate, Kenta Maeda, should be the runner-up as a steady, dependable starter on a team ravaged by pitching injuries. The Cardinals\xe2\x80\x99 Aledmys Diaz, the Rockies\xe2\x80\x99 Trevor Story and the Nationals\xe2\x80\x99 Trea Turner each have a strong case for the final spot, but Diaz gets the edge because he played the most games.  Advertisement  Continue reading the main story  Runners-up: 2) Kenta Maeda, Dodgers; 3) Aledmys Diaz, St. Louis.N.L. Manager of the YearDave Roberts, Los Angeles DodgersDave Roberts took over a team that had won the last three N.L. West titles under Don Mattingly \xe2\x80\x94 and won the division again. But Roberts\xe2\x80\x99s path to the top was filled with obstacles that might have sunk other teams, and he guided his group skillfully in his first year as a manager. Handling a bullpen is a critical skill for a manager, and Roberts \xe2\x80\x94 with no relievers in defined roles besides closer Kenley Jansen \xe2\x80\x94 found a way to put his staff in position to succeed. The Dodgers led the majors in bullpen E.R.A.  Advertisement  Continue reading the main story  Roberts also worked well with the Dodgers\xe2\x80\x99 analytically minded front office, getting veterans to buy into the organization\xe2\x80\x99s vision.                     });                 });             }          } })();  As soon as the Red Sox took a 3-0 lead in the top of the eighth inning Wednesday night, Lou Cucuzza Jr., the longtime manager of the visiting clubhouse at Yankee Stadium, put in the call to stadium operations. It was a go.Within seconds, a crew of maintenance workers descended on the visiting clubhouse with rolls of plastic wrap, tape and staple guns, feverishly erecting a protective wrapper around the roughly 900-square-foot room.But out on the field, the Yankees began a wild comeback in the bottom of the ninth inning, which Cucuzza watched carefully. If the Yankees won \xe2\x80\x94 as they did \xe2\x80\x94 and if the Baltimore Orioles lost to the Toronto Blue Jays, the Red Sox would not clinch the American League East title. Cucuzza and the maintenance crew would have had to tear down the work they had just completed in only a few minutes, before the losing players returned to the clubhouse.\xe2\x80\x9cI had my phone, and I was also watching the score in Toronto,\xe2\x80\x9d Cucuzza said. \xe2\x80\x9cIt was close, but when I saw the Orioles scored in the ninth, I just said to leave it all up.\xe2\x80\x9d Continue reading the main story        Advertisement  Continue reading the main story      When the Orioles won on Wednesday, the Red Sox clinched the division and were able to celebrate. Now it could be the Orioles\xe2\x80\x99 turn, leaving Cucuzza and his crew to arrange and clean up a second celebration.  Advertisement  Continue reading the main story  The Orioles, who lost to the Yankees, 7-3, on Saturday, could clinch a wild-card berth on Sunday, which would result in Yankee Stadium having hosted two Champagne-and-beer celebrations in less than a week, neither involving the Yankees themselves. Times have certainly changed.\xe2\x80\x9cIf you win, you\xe2\x80\x99ve earned that right,\xe2\x80\x9d Joe Girardi, the Yankees\xe2\x80\x99 manager, said with a shrug. \xe2\x80\x9cIf you don\xe2\x80\x99t want them to celebrate, then don\xe2\x80\x99t let them beat you.\xe2\x80\x9dClubhouse celebrations have been a tradition in baseball dating at least to the 1950s. But with the advent of divisional play, and then of three divisions and two wild-card teams in recent years, the Champagne-infused fiestas have mushroomed.  Advertisement  Continue reading the main story  There are now five playoff teams in each league, so 10 teams can celebrate their entrance into the postseason. With each round of the playoffs (two wild-card games, two division series, two league championships and one World Series) factored in, baseball can have a total of 17 \xe2\x80\x9cChampagne fights,\xe2\x80\x9d as Japanese reporters like to call them. Privacy Policy    The unsung heroes of all these celebrations are the clubhouse attendants, like Cucuzza, who are charged with preparing for and cleaning up long after the last drop of Champagne has been poured over the last man on the roster.  Advertisement  Continue reading the main story  \xe2\x80\x9cWe finished cleaning up around 3:30 in the morning,\xe2\x80\x9d Cucuzza said of Wednesday night\xe2\x80\x99s celebrations, \xe2\x80\x9cand that\xe2\x80\x99s faster than it used to be. But the kids did a tremendous job. The Red Sox players came in the next day and said they couldn\xe2\x80\x99t believe it did not even smell.\xe2\x80\x9dThat was in part because of a celebration innovation that could become as common as protective eyewear. Like a sharp baseball scout, Cucuzza was watching the Chicago Cubs celebrate their division championship on television last month when he noticed plastic wrapping on the floor of the Cubs\xe2\x80\x99 clubhouse, not just over the lockers.\xe2\x80\x9cI thought, \xe2\x80\x98There\xe2\x80\x99s an idea,\xe2\x80\x99\xe2\x80\x9d Cucuzza said.So he and his staff did the same thing for the Red Sox\xe2\x80\x99 celebration Wednesday. When the party was over, Cucuzza and five members of his clubhouse staff gathered around sections of the plastic and lifted up the corners, creating a kiddie pool of the remnants of Champagne and beer. They carried it into a hamper and out to be drained. The process was repeated for the remaining sections of floor covering.  Advertisement  Continue reading the main story  When they were done, a cleaning crew shampooed the rug. In years past, when all the Champagne and beer spilled directly onto the carpet, the cleaning crew would have to come in two or three times to extract the liquid and shampoo the rug, and the smell would linger for days.  Advertisement  Continue reading the main story  The Red Sox celebrated their division title on Wednesday despite having lost on a game-ending grand slam by Mark Teixeira. If the Orioles had lost to the Blue Jays, Cucuzza and his staff would have quickly removed the carts full of Champagne and beer, as well as all that plastic. There would not have been time, however, to put all the furniture back in place.\xe2\x80\x9cIt\xe2\x80\x99s a tradition,\xe2\x80\x9d Red Sox Manager John Farrell said the day after the party. \xe2\x80\x9cLast night was surreal. It was odd. Do you celebrate after a loss? That\xe2\x80\x99s kind of a fundamental question.\xe2\x80\x9d  Advertisement  Continue reading the main story  The Orioles knew on Saturday that they could face similar circumstances on Sunday. If the Tigers lose on Sunday, and the Seattle Mariners were also to lose one of their last two games, then the Orioles could clinch even if they lose to the Yankees on Sunday.Buck Showalter, the Orioles\xe2\x80\x99 manager, has refused even to discuss any advance scouting for the playoffs, let alone the idea of celebrating after a loss.\xe2\x80\x9cWe are trying to do something that makes us that team,\xe2\x80\x9d he said before Saturday\xe2\x80\x99s loss.But if the Orioles do end up partying at Yankee Stadium on Sunday, Cucuzza and his staff will be there to clean it up.
